characters: IF YOU SAY BEAST ONE MORE TIME, I WILL
TABLES, CHAIRS, A FEATHER DUSTER. A MANTLE CLOCK AND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAGNIFICENT CASTLE. Resplendent, bespeaking great wealt power. The grounds and stonework immaculate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once upon a time in the hidden heart of France, a handsome young Prince lived in a beautiful castle... RACK FOCUS to a single RED ROSE clinging to a rose bush o stormy spring night. A WEATHERED HAND plucks the rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although he had everything his heart desired, the Prince was selfish and                      unkind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON THE PRINCE being groomed by his servants. (We do see their faces.) A FRENCH MAID paints an exotic animal m on the Prince's face with a feather brush. A TALL VALET d the Prince with an elaborately bejeweled coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He taxed the village to fill his castle with the most beautiful                           objects... The MAID dusts his wig with powder -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poof poof...                                             - while a MAJORDOMO holds a POCKET WATCH, indicating that are running late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master, it's time.                                       With a haughty wave, the Prince instructs his FOOTMAN to bring more light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oui, maГ®tre.                                             A CANDELABRA is lifted to the preening Prince as he looks himself in an ornate HAND MIRROR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and his parties with the most                        beautiful people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ornate room is filled with BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE from all corners of the world, each on display for the Prince's pleasure. A circle of eligible maidens bow their heads. Seated in a throne chair dominated by a majestic COAT OF ARMS, the Prince snaps his fingers impatiently at an ITAL MAESTRO, who smiles, revealing comically rotten teeth. The maestro sits at a harpsichord and motions to his wife LARGE DIVA holding a TINY BICHON FRISГ‰. As the music beg the Prince steps forward. The diva fills the room with a voice as big as her frame. The Prince performs a ROUNDELAY with several debutantes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh how divine Glamour, music and magic combine See the maidens so anxious to shine Look for a sign that enhances Chances She'll be his special one

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dance speeds up. The Prince connects momentarily with beautiful woman -- but quickly moves on when his eye catc someone even more dazzling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a display! What a breathtaking thrilling array (coos to the dog)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every prince, every dog has his day Let us sing with passion, gusto Fit to bust - oh Not a care in the world KNOCK KNOCK. The Prince stops. Then a gust of wind blows the windows. Sconces flicker and go dark. The figure ente in silhouette, hobbling on a CANE. Furious, the Prince grabs a lit candelabra from the Footm He rudely pushes through the crowd, sweeping people from path. He crosses to the windows, finally revealing -- AN OLD BEGGAR WOMAN shivering from the rain. She looks to Prince with hope and offers him -- A RED ROSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, one night, an unexpected intruder arrived at the castle, seeking shelter from the bitter storm. As a gift, she offered the Prince a single rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PRINCE'S HAND waves her off.    The woman begs on her The Prince motions to the staff. NARRATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repulsed by her haggard appearance, the Prince turned the woman away. But she warned him not to be deceived by appearances, for beauty is found within. The majordomo and footman approach to usher her out.   Th lowers her head as if to cry -- NARRATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when he dismissed her again, the old woman's outward appearance melted away to reveal... Suddenly, the old woman's cape and hood cocoon.    AN ERU LIGHT as she transforms into... NARRATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a beautiful Enchantress. The wind picks up inside the room.   Frightened, the Prin falls to his knees. NARRATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prince tried to apologize but it was too late. For she had seen that there was no love in his heart. As the Prince begs for mercy, his body begins to transfor His jewelry pops off. His clothing rips as he grows large NARRATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As punishment, she transformed him into a hideous beast... The guests scream in horror and flee. But pushing his way through the crowd, A YOUNG BOY slips into the ballroom, watching in wonder as -- the PRINCE'S SHADOW twists into SHADOW OF A HIDEOUS BEAST. The boy's mother frantically follows him inside -- BOY'S MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip!   Chip! Oh my... -- just as the doors slam shut, leaving the staff, the entertainers and the dog trapped in the room. NARRATOR (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and placed a powerful spell on the castle and all who lived there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a portrait of the handsome prince -- as the beas giant paw slashes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Years later, the enchanted castle stands isolated. The property is surrounded by an ice hedge. The only sound is grim winter wind. As we move closer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As days bled into years, the Prince and his servants were forgotten by the world. For the Enchantress had erased all memory of them from the minds of the people they loved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the highest window of the west wing, we see THE BEAST. ROSE, already wilting, floats before him. To protect it, beast has covered it with a glass bell jar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the rose she had offered was truly an enchanted rose. If he could learn to love another and earn their love in return by the time the last petal fell, the spell would be broken. If not, he would be doomed to remain a beast for all time. TIGHT ON THE ROSE -- another petal drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the years passed, he fell into despair and lost all hope. For who could ever learn to love a beast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door of a cozy cottage opens to reveal -- BELLE pure beauty blessed with intelligent, fiercely inquisitiv With book in hand, she takes a deep breath of morning air gazes toward the church which peeks above the village roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little town, it's a quiet village Every day like the one before Little town full of little people Waking up to say... Belle looks at the clock on the church counting to 8am. for it. 3. 2. 1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On cue, the villagers begin their day. A HOUSEWIFE opens window, nods to a WOMAN shaking out a rug nearby. A BUTCH opens his shop, waves to a COBBLER moving past with his c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonjour.   Bonjour. Bonjour.   Bonjour. An old VAGRANT is the only one to notice Belle, smiling a as he's tossed inside a HOLDING TANK by two GENDARMES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonjour. Belle weaves between the villagers, making herself invisi She passes a harried BAKER, buys a baguette --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There goes the baker with his tray like always The same old bread and rolls to sell Belle approaches JEAN, the potter, tending to his MULE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every morning just the same Since the morning that we came To this poor provincial town

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Belle Jean scratches his head, trying to remember something. searches his cart which is loaded with pottery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Monsieur Jean.   Have you lost something again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe I have. Problem is, I can't remember what. Well, I'm sure it will come to me. As she leaves:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you off to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To return this book to Pere Robert. It's about two lovers in fair Verona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds boring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later -- Belle passes SCHOOL BOYS as they march into the house. Their heads turn in unison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look there she goes That girl is strange, no question The NASTY HEADMASTER ushers them in impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dazed and distracted, can't you tell? As the boys scramble into school, Belle steps on the ston over the duck pond -- revealing GIRLS forced into "woman' work" chores, washing clothes in the circular laverie. They're surrounded by women kneading clothes on barrels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never part of any crowd `Cause her head's up on some cloud

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No denying she's a funny girl That Belle A FLIRTATIOUS FARMER approaches a PRETTY FISHMONGER'S WIF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonjour, good day, how is your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonjour, good day, how is your wife? THE FISHMONGER pops up next to his wife, sending the woul Lothario into retreat. Another fishmonger, the shrewish CLOTHILDE, accosts him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need six eggs The FARMER points out the price.   Belle moves past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too expensive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be more than this provincial life

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle escapes into the peace and serenity of a country church. Jolly PERE ROBERT looks up as she enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well! If it isn't the only bookworm                    in town. So where did you run off to                   this week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two cities in Northern Italy.    I                     didn't want to come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle hands "Romeo and Juliet" to Pere Robert, who dutifu returns it to the shelves of the town's "library": a COUP DOZEN BOOKS in total. She remains hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got any new places to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid not. But you may reread any of the old ones that you'd like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Pere Robert. Your library almost makes our small corner of the                   world feel big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles.    Belle picks up a new book and smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bon voyage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON BELLE -- nose planted in her book, she walks dow into the crowded market which is just being set up. Belle passes TOM, DICK, and STANLEY - all burly, tough guys. TOM, DICK & STANLEY                          Look -- there she goes The girl is so peculiar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle buys jam then glides past an APOTHECARY's open cart

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if she's feeling well

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle ducks under CHEESE SELLERS carrying their trays:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a dreamy far-off look And her nose stuck in a book What a puzzle to the rest of us Is Belle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind her, FLORISTS pass with huge bouquets. It's a glor parade but Belle remains oblivious as she continues to re

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... isn't this amazing? It's my favorite part because you'll see Here's where she meets Prince Charming But she won't discover that it's him `Til chapter three Three fashion-crazed VILLAGE LASSES -- all dressed in the style -- pop their heads from the windows of the dress sh Their MOTHER, who is besotted with Belle, heads outside w she sees her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's no wonder that her name means "Beauty" Her looks have got no parallel Her daughters follow, seething with jealousy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But behind that fair facade I'm afraid she's rather odd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (greets Belle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very different from the rest of us

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's nothing like the rest of us Yes, different from the rest of us Belle slips through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Belle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down on the village is GASTON, a dashingly handso war hero clad in a dazzling gold breastplate. The only th bigger than his muscles is his ego. Strapped on his saddl is a musket and the spoils of his hunt: rabbit, fox, and fowl. Riding beside him is Gaston's long-suffering aide-d camp and devoted best friend LEFOU. Through his spyglass, Gaston spots Belle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at her, LeFou. My future wife.                      Belle is the most beautiful girl in                      the village. That makes her the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's so well-read, and you're so... (about to say "not")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Athletically inclined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Belle can be as argumentative as she is beautiful. LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly, who needs her, when you've                    got us!                                                GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but ever since the war I've been                  missing something. And she's the only girl I've met who gives me that sense of... LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Je ne sais quoi?                                       GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what that means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston and LeFou ride through the village gates. Gaston motions toward Belle in the village square. Geese flock around her feet, seeming to follow her. GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Right from the moment when I met her, saw her I said she's gorgeous and I fell Here in town there's only she Who is beautiful as me So I'm making plans to woo and marry Belle As Gaston passes, the lasses try to catch his eye. VILLAGE LASSES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look there he goes, isn't he dreamy Monsieur Gaston, oh he's so cute Be still my heart I'm hardly breathing He's such a tall, dark, strong and handsome brute As Gaston dismounts, the lasses get splattered with mud f his horse's hooves. LeFou shoots them a look, whispers: LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's never gonna happen, ladies.                       Noticing Belle crossing the market, Gaston starts off in pursuit. He grabs flowers from the PERFUME STALL and make bouquet. As they each make their way through the market:

dialogues.speaker: WASHER WOMEN
dialogues.text: Bonjour!                           Pardon!

dialogues.speaker: BELLE BARMAID
dialogues.text: Good day.                          Mais oui!

dialogues.speaker: TOM HOUSEWIFE
dialogues.text: You call this bacon?               What lovely flowers!

dialogues.speaker: CHEESEMAKER
dialogues.text: Some cheese...                     ...Ten yards!

dialogues.speaker: BREAD BUYER GASTON
dialogues.text: ...One pound.                      `Scuse me!

dialogues.speaker: CHEESEMAKER
dialogues.text: I'll get the knife.                Please let me through!

dialogues.speaker: JAM SELLER COBBLER
dialogues.text: This bread...                      Those fish...

dialogues.speaker: JAM SELLER COBBLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's stale!                        They smell!

dialogues.speaker: BELLE GASTON
dialogues.text: There must be more than this       Just watch -- I'm goin provincial life!                   make Belle my wife! The image swells to reveal the whole village, singing. ALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look there she goes a girl who's Strange but special A most peculiar mademoiselle It's a pity and a sin She doesn't quite fit in! VILLAGE LASSES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she really is a funny girl VILLAGE MEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beauty but a funny girl ALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She really is a funny girl that Belle!                   Slightly out of breath, Gaston finally catches up with Be GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Belle!   Wonderful book you                have there. BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've read it? GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, not that one. But, you know.                       Books.                                                   (hands her the flowers) For your dinner table. Shall I join you this evening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, not tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.                                                       A mortified smile and Belle is off.   LeFou approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.   Moving on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, LeFou. It's the ones who play                         hard to get that are always the                           sweetest prey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what makes Belle so appealing.                     She hasn't made a fool of herself just                    to gain my favor. What would you call                     that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's outrageously attractive, isn't                       it?                                                       Gaston looks at the village lasses standing outside of th tavern. They all give him the eye. Gaston saunters over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle hears the tinkle of a sweet MUSIC BOX tune wafting her father's basement workshop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle descends into to her father's dusty work room. Sunl spotlights MAURICE hunched over his workspace. Belle quie watches as he sings along with the music box theme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does a moment last forever?                           How can a story never die?                                It is love we must hold on to                             Never easy -- but we try                                  Maurice tinkers with gears on the box, which depicts an a in a Parisian garret, painting his wife's portrait as she a red rose above their baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAURICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes our happiness is captured Somehow a time and place stand still Love lives on inside our hearts And always will (seeing Belle) Oh, good, Belle, you're back. Can you                 please hand me the -- Before he can say the word "screwdriver" it's in his hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the --                                            Tweezers.   Then Belle hands him a small hammer... MAURICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no I don't need --                                 ... just as a spring pops off. MAURICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually yes, that's exactly what I                   need.                                                 He goes back to tinkering. Belle gazes at other music box each a small work of art, depicting famous landmarks from around the world. BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa, do you think I'm odd? MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter? Odd?     Where did you get               an idea like that? BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. People talk.                            MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. People. This village may be                       small, small-minded even, but small                   also means safe.                                      Maurice can see this line of argument doesn't do much for daughter. MAURICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even back in Paris, I knew a girl who                 was so different, so daring, so ahead of her time that people mocked her until the day they found themselves imitating her.                                        BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me one more thing about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice turns to the music box as if to change the subjec But looking back up to Belle's eagerness, he relents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother was... fearless.                              Fearless.                                                 With that, Maurice closes his music box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Maurice carefully loads his music boxes onto his wagon Belle tends to the family's old glue horse, PHILIPPE. Maurice climbs into the wagon, and smiles down at his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you like me to bring you from the market?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rose like the one in the painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ask for that every year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And every year, you bring it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I shall bring you another. You                       have my word. Come on, Philippe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you tomorrow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow!    With the rose!                               As Maurice rides away, Belle's warmth gives way to concer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay safe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrounded by design sketches, Belle's workbench features small model of her `washing machine' prototype. Belle pla the miniature barrel in position... fastens a rope to a leather strap... shaves chips off a block of soap... coll the soap chips in a small sack... and rushes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young WASHER GIRL watches as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle tosses clothes and some soap chips into an empty BA and rolls it into the fountain! It bobs on its side. Tyin other end of the strap to the mule's harness, she sets hi walking around the circular laverie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The laundry. With a smile, Belle points to the rotating barrel, which resembles a very early Whirlpool washing machine. Belle t her book and quietly begins to read. After a moment, she up to find the washer girl staring at her, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come!                                                    Belle waves for the girl to join her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NASTY HEADMASTER emerges from the school house to see The barrel is now filled with sudsy clothes. Belle is sit with the washer girl. She holds a book open, teaching the to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blue bird flies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...over the dark wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What on earth are you doing? He is joined by the fishmonger CLOTHILDE, outraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teaching another girl to read? Isn't                     one enough?                                              Belle locks eyes with the headmaster, then turns back to girl. The headmaster seethes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle's washing machine is hauled out of the laverie and dumped onto the ground. She collects her laundry from the dirt, trying to remain poised before the gawking crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston shakes his head and laughs, absolutely smitten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are the wildest, most beautiful thing I've ever seen. No one deserves you, but at least I know our children will be beautiful. A reverse angle reveals Gaston was addressing his reflect in a shop window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I catching you at a bad time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, LeFou?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A certain damsel is in distress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh well. It's hero time. (to his reflection)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not done with you yet. And he's off.   LeFou steps up to the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston follows Belle back to her cottage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle! Heard you had a little trouble with the headmaster. He never liked me, either. Can I give you a little advice about the villagers, though? They're never going to trust the kind of change we're trying to bring. Pursuing her into her garden, he trampling cabbages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I wanted was to teach a child to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only children you should concern yourself with are... your own. Belle looks for a way out.   She doesn't like where this going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not ready to have children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you haven't met the right man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a small village, Gaston.     I've met them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should take another look. Some of us have changed. She climbs the steps to her cottage door.    Gaston follo close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston, we could never make each other happy. No one can change that much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle, do you know what happens to spinsters in our village after their fathers die? Gaston motions to the street, where we find AGATHE, a spinster, late 30's, dirty and homeless, rattling her cup "alms for the poor?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They beg for scraps, like poor Agathe. This is our world, Belle. For simple folk like us, it doesn't get any better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might be a farm girl, but I'm not simple. I'm sorry, but I will never marry you, Gaston. Gaston keeps the gallant smile plastered as she shuts the in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle watches Gaston leave.   She opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you imagine? Me, the wife of that boorish, brainless... She turns away from the home she thinks she will never escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame Gaston, can't you just see it Madame Gaston, his little wife No sir, not me, I guarantee it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want much more than this Provincial life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle races up the hills to the outskirts of town. When s reaches the highest point, we circle around to reveal the spread out beneath her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want adventure in the great wide somewhere I want it more than I can tell And for once it might be grand To have someone understand I want so much more than They've got planned As the last rays of light fade we RISE to reveal a forest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: distance, where the skies begin to rage. A swirling wind streak of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightning. The sky flashes.     The wind picks up.   Worr Maurice urges Philippe on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woods are lovely, aren't they Philippe...? I only wish I recognized them. Do you know where we are? Because I don't. As the woods get darker, a WITHERED TREE that looks like ELDERLY PERSON'S CANE is struck by lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! The tree splits in two, one half falling into the road, revealing... a HIDDEN PATH. Philippe whinnies nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm... yes, we can go this way. Walk on! One path closes, another one opens. They leave the blocked road and head down the path.    Ma looks down to see a light snow cover on the ground.    Ph snorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right boy, it's just a bit of snow... in June. And they descend into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have entered another world. A light, whirling snow descends on Maurice, dusting his coat. The clippity-clop hooves echo in stillness. Suddenly, A WHITE WOLF roars out of the bushes, barely mi them. Gaze darting, Maurice notices WHITE WOLVES running icy ledge above him. The wolves keep pace, massing to ove him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, Philippe! Hurry! Maurice urges his horse on, but his rickety cart starts t buckle. A HARNESS IS LOOSE. The wolves leap in front of the cart, which comes undone, tipping over on its side. The chest of music boxes smashe on the ground. Maurice is launched up onto a ridge -- and himself face-to-face with the snarling and scarred ALPHA Terrified, Maurice turns and begins sliding down the snow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- towards a trio of wolves waiting below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philippe!                                                 As Maurice drops from the ridge, Philippe appears beneath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and Maurice lands on his back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!   Go!                                                 Philippe rides. PAWS crush twigs -- SLAVERING JAWS -- EYE with hunger -- a gleam of FANGS -- Philippe gallops. Maur races toward the CASTLE ICE GATES -- which churn open as wolves draw near. Maurice and Philippe speed through the gates as the wolve to a stop, their HOWLS turning to YELPS OF FEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice stares in open-mouth awe at THE BEAST'S CASTLE. A edifice seemingly growing out of stone and reaching to tr skies. It feels like a place hiding its face from the wor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Philippe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Philippe, you saved my life...                         They'll have to get their dinner                          somewhere else.                                           ANGLE ON MAURICE -- as he draws near the castle, he notic colonnade filled with WHITE ROSE BUSHES. Just beyond, he the door to the STABLES swinging in the wind. A LAMP has lit inside. As if inviting a tired traveler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice strokes Philippe's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water, fresh hay. Looks like you're set, old friend. Rest here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warily, Maurice peers out at the intimidating castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While I pay my respects to our unwitting host... whoever that may be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves.    Philippe stares uneasily at a statue of a h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cautiously, Maurice approaches the castle door. He gazes a row of TORCHES held by sculpted iron hands. The hands a life-like, does a double-take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the DOOR OPENS with a creak.      Maurice peers in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?   Anyone home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Flashes of lightning illuminate a once-elegant s now fallen into disrepair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me, I don't mean to intrude.   I need shelter from the storm. Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice puts his hat and coat on a COAT RACK at the entra Maurice turns, not seeing the coat rack shake the snow of Maurice explores,     scanning the room and its FURNITURE

dialogues.speaker: TABLES, CHAIRS, A FEATHER DUSTER. A MANTLE CLOCK AND
dialogues.text: CANDELABRA SIT ON     A TABLE. As Maurice passes them, th candelabra slowly     TURNS -- as if watching him. This i LUMIГ€RE, formerly     head footman to the Prince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must have lost his way in the woods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The candelabra continues craning -- while the mantle cloc beside it remains rigid. Meet COGSWORTH, every bit the st upper-lip majordomo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)                                             Shut up, you idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing this, Maurice spins -- but sees only an ordinary candelabra and clock on the table. Curious, he approaches leaning down to the clock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm... extraordinary.                                      He picks up the candelabra, inspecting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is beautiful...                                      An echo of eerie harpsichord music makes Maurice turn tow the ballroom. He places the candelabra back down and exit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man of taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was talking about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice walks through a door into a dark cavernous room. eyes adjust to the light and he realizes he's in a VAST BALLROOM. Once the scene of joy, the ballroom knows only decay. Suddenly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops!                                                     -- The harpsichord stops playing.    Wary, Maurice goes b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice crosses to a crackling fire, speaking to his unse host.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever you are, I'm just going to                       warm myself by the fire...                                Maurice warms his frozen fingers, rubs his hands together spread the heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better. Oh, much better...                         As Maurice turns to warm his backside, he hears the clink silverware from an adjoining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice enters to find a vast dining room dominated by a BANQUET TABLE where a meal has been set out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Famished, Maurice sits, tears off a hunk of bread and dev it ravenously. As Maurice looks around for something to wash down the fo CUP OF TEA slides into his hand. Maurice calmly gives the double-take. Meet CHIP, an 8 year-old boy tea cup. He whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom said I wasn't supposed to move because it might be scary. Sorry. Maurice chews, smiles benevolently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. And bolts from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like any sane person, Maurice backs toward the door. and calls into the shadows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Really, I cannot thank you enough for your hospitality... (takes his coat and hat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And kindness. A flash of lightning briefly illuminates a BEASTLY SHAPE staircase. At the next flash -- THE SHAPE IS GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice rides Philippe away from the castle.        He no colonnade filled with rose bushes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roses!   Yes... Maurice dismounts, checking to see that he hasn't been followed from the castle. He strokes his nervous horse, leaving him outside as he enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't go home empty handed... I promised Belle a rose, didn't I?      I think it's safe... We catch GLIMPSES of A DARK SHAPE moving atop the colonna A taloned PAW. A swishing TAIL. Philippe snorts, sensing danger. Maurice spies a single PERFECT WHITE ROSE among the others. CLOSE on the beast's EYES.     Enraged.   Wounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!                                                       Pricked by a thorn, he pulls his hand back -- then tries again. He PICKS the rose -- only to hear a booming ROAR f above. ANGLE ON MAURICE -- terrified as the dark shape leaps dow from the colonnade. Maurice drops the rose, stumbling and falling as a DARK SHADOW is cast over him. Philippe breaks his harness, whinnies in terror and flees charging through the castle grounds and out the ice gates

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A first whisper of dawn as Philippe bursts out of the for He thunders down to the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is fresh on the horizon, and Belle is already up. whinny disturbs her. She looks up to find Philippe, thirs and exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philippe? Belle puts strokes the horse's neck as he drinks deeply f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: trough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Where is Papa?!                            Belle goes still. Notices Philippe's torn straps and tatt reins. In dread, her gaze darts to the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me to him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight barely seeps through the thick branches lighting Belle's way as Philippe gallops past the FALLEN CANE TREE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle races through the enchanted woods, coming upon Maur tipped over wagon. She sees the broken chest and scattere music boxes. With a mix of apprehension and determination, Belle sets jaw, and continues the gallop until the path brings her t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle dismounts Philippe. Finding a THICK BRANCH, she wie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: like a club, then bravely crosses to the castle and enter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Club held high, ready to defend herself, Belle cautiously the door open and peeks inside. The atmosphere of the castle presses in on Belle. Creepy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STATUES on the staircase seem like they're watching. Eeri SHADOWS stretch down impossibly long hallways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Cogsworth. A beautiful girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see it's a girl.    I lost my hands, not my eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if she is the one?   The one who will break the spell? Belle reacts.   Quickly moves towards the voices --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said that? Who's there? Belle reaches the spot where she heard the voices. No one there. Only a clock and candelabra. Suddenly, a COUGH ech through the castle. Belle grabs the candelabra and climbs long staircase. The clock shudders with dread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle follows the cough up a labyrinth of stairs until sh reaches the dark prison tower and a GRATED IRON DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa!?   Is that you? Belle sees Maurice through a grate in the door.   He look terribly pale and sick, coughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle?   How did you find me!? Belle puts the candelabra down and clutches his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, your hands are ice.   We need to get you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle, you must leave here at once.                  This castle is alive! Now go, before                 he finds you!                                        BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?!                                                The beast roars. Belle spins quickly, swinging her club t strike, but the figure jumps onto another staircase. Bell searches the shadows. The voice circles her. BELLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there? Who are you? THE BEAST (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?                                         BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've come for my father.                             THE BEAST (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father is a thief. BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar!                                                THE BEAST (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: HE STOLE A ROSE.
dialogues.text: In Belle's wide eyes, we see her guilt. BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked for the rose.   Punish me, not               him!                                                 MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he means forever. Apparently                     that's what happens around here when                 you pick a flower.                                   BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A life sentence for a rose? THE BEAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I received eternal damnation for one. I'm merely locking him away. Now... do               you still wish to take your father's place? BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come into the light. The figure remains still. Belle grabs hold of Lumiere and thrusts the candle forward, illuminating a HIDEOUS HORNED FACE. Belle's eyes go wide as she clearly sees THE BEAST. The only part of him that seems human are his eyes. BLUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEEP. SOULFUL.   And flicked with pain when he sees Belle revulsion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle, I won't let you do this. I                         lost your mother. I won't lose you                        too. Now go!                                              Maurice falls into a terrible coughing fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Papa. I will leave.                              (to the beast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a minute alone with him.                           The beast doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you so cold-hearted that you won't                    allow a daughter to kiss her father                       goodbye?                                                  (off his proud grunt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forever can spare a minute! Intrigued by her defiance, the beast moves toward her, re out with his massive paw. Belle closes her eyes, bracing herself for his retaliation. Instead, she hears -- CLANG. Belle opens her eyes to find herself eye to eye with the chest. He has reached high above her head to pull down an lever, unlocking the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When this door closes, it will not open again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle rushes in and embraces her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have been with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle, listen to me. It's all right.                      Live your life. Forget me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget you? Everything I am is because                    of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Belle.    Don't be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too, Papa... She pulls him close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid. (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I will escape, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! With that, she pivots and swings her father through the d just as the beast slams it shut. Maurice trips to the gro giving the beast a second to turn to Belle. They lock eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took his place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a fool. So are you. The beast turns and drags Maurice away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hurt him! Through the latticework, Belle sees the beast and her fat disappear down the corridor. She rushes to the window and watches the beast carry her father down the spiral stairc of the prison tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle!   I'll come back!    I promise! Once she is alone, Belle cannot help herself.      She sl the floor and the tears come. We FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle huddles in the corner.     The cell door swings ope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive my intrusion, mademoiselle, but I have been sent to escort you to your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle wipes her tears and stands.    She grabs a small st ready to strike. BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My room?   But I thought -- LUMIГ€RE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? That once this door closes it                      will not open again, RARRR? I know, he                   gets so dramatic.                                        Belle bounds out of the cell, raising the stool to hit a man. Instead, she sees... a candelabra wave at her. LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Allo. BELLE

dialogues.speaker: AHHH
dialogues.text: Like seeing a mouse, Belle bashes the candelabra. It grun it clatters on the stone floor. The candles extinguished. WHOOSH -- the first candle relights. WHOOSH -- the second Illuminated by the two arm candles, Belle makes out EYES rudimentary "FACE" in the design. LUMIГ€RE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recovering) Oh, you are very strong.    That's a                     great quality! BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you? The arms light the main candle to reveal a rakish smile. LUMIГ€RE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am LumiГЁre. BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you can talk.                                        Cogsworth appears, out of breath. COGSWORTH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course he can talk, it's all he                       ever does! Now Lumiere, as head of                       the household, I demand that you put                     her back in the cell at once!                            Officially freaked out now, Belle retreats to her cell, i search of a better weapon. LUMIГ€RE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to be for the rest of                   your life, Cogsworth: a man or a mantle                  clock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn back to Belle, re-emerging from the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready, miss?                                            (to Cogsworth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding LumiГЁre, Belle follows Cogsworth across a stone high above the grounds. Her eyes dart, looking for an esc route. Instead, she sees how vast the castle and woods ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must forgive first impressions, I                   hope you are not too startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I be startled?   I'm talking                  to a candle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candelabra, please. Enormous                            difference. But consider me at your                     service. The castle is your home now,                   so feel free to go anywhere you like --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except the west wing!                                   LumiГЁre throws him a `would-you-please-shut-up' look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which we do not have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, what's in the west wing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... nothing. Storage space.   That's                  it.                                                     Belle looks back at the spooky tower of the west wing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the east wing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or as I like to call it, the only                       wing! Watch your step s'il vous                         plait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle stands outside the bedroom door, anticipating worse squalor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to your new home. It's                           modest, but comfortable...                               Instead, the door opens to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the most beautiful, magical room she's ever seen.   Th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ceiling is a painting of white clouds in a blue sky.   Th LARGE DRESSER and a COMFORTABLE BED. Opulence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Master wanted you to have the finest room in the castle. LumiГЁre leaps onto the bed and - POOF - dust fills the a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear!   We were not expecting guests.                 PLUMETTE, a feather duster, swoops into the room, giving surfaces a quick dusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EnchantГ©, Mademoiselle! Don't worry,                     I'll have this room spotless in no                       time!                                                    She lands in the arms of LumiГЁre, whose candles burn a l hotter once she speaks in her sexy French accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This plan of yours is... dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would risk anything to kiss you again, Plumette. He moves to embrace her, but she stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, my love. I've been burned by you before. We must be strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I be strong when you make me so weak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cogsworth clears his throat.    Belle backs away from the strange creatures. BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything here alive? (picks up a HAIR BRUSH)                               Hello, what's your name?                                  Cogsworth looks up at her, puzzled. COGSWORTH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... that's a hair brush.                                Belle hears a loud SNORE behind her, and turns to see the DRESSER bursting open with an operatic "laaaaaa!" Belle shrieks and steps back. LUMIГ€RE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not be alarmed, mademoiselle. This is just your wardrobe. Meet Madame De Garderobe. A great singer. COGSWORTH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she can stay awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cogsworth!     A diva needs her beauty rrr-               MADAME DE GARDEROBE yawns loudly. LUMIГ€RE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, stay with us, Madame!    We have                      someone for you to dress! Garderobe's gilded arms stroke Belle's shoulder and face. GARDEROBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally. A woman. Pretty eyes.                            Proud face. Perfect canvas. Yes! I                        will find you something worthy of a princess. BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm not a princess. GARDEROBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense! Now, let's see what I've                        got in my drawers. Garderobe's doors open and a few moths fly out. GARDEROBE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, how embarrassing. Garderobe places a large HOOP over Belle's head, and proc to create an outfit using fabric and her pinking-shear ha FROUFROU, a piano stool, runs in, barking like a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, Froufrou. Come help mama!                      Froufrou tugs at the fabric, helping Garderobe complete t outfit -- which is garish and too too much, all wrong for Belle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfetta!                                                 LumiГЁre and Cogsworth put on a game smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm.   Subtle. Understated.    I love it!                  With a deep bow and a whistle for Froufrou, LumiГЁre drag Cogsworth out. Plumette and Froufrou follow. Garderobe ca out after her beloved dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Froufrou, send my love to the maestro! The door closes. Belle is alone. Garderobe instantly fall asleep with a big SNORE. Belle has one beat of... where t hell am I? She ducks down, then crawls out from underneat the enormous dress, which remains standing. Belle looks around the room with one thing in mind: escap She quickly moves to the window. Opens it. She looks down at the 100 foot drop leading to the grounds. Belle turns back to the room, and gazes at the dress.   A idea taking shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LAMPLIGHTER is hard at work outside as we hear fiddle m coming from the inn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amidst the animal heads, antlers, and drunken villagers, is an even sadder sight -- GASTON. He drowns his sorrows while LEFOU listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picture it, LeFou -- a rustic cabin. My latest kill roasting on the fire. Adorable children running around us while my love rubs my tired feet. But                     what does Belle say? "I will never                        marry you, Gaston."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, there are other girls.                          The village lasses perk up.   "Yes!   There are other gir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great hunter doesn't waste his time on rabbits. The lasses deflate. "Awww!" LeFou decides it's time to ch up his best friend/boss. Thus begins "GASTON." LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh it disturbs me to see you Gaston looking so down in the dumps Every guy here'd love to be you Gaston Even when taking your lumps There's no man in town as admired as you You're everyone's fa-vor-ite guy Everyone's awed and inspired by you And it's not very hard to see why LeFou gives a nod (and a large tip) to the FIDDLE PLAYER corner, who nods back, and begins to play... LEFOU (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's slick as Gaston No one's quick as Gaston No one's neck's as incredibly thick as Gaston For there's no man in town half as manly Perfect, a pure paragon! You can ask any Tom, Dick or Stanley And they'll tell you whose team they prefer to be on! LeFou hops onto the bar, squeezing himself between TOM, D and STANLEY. TOM/DICK/STANLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who plays darts like Gaston? Who breaks hearts like Gaston? LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's much more than the sum of his parts like Gaston? GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidence growing)                             As a specimen, yes, I'm intimidating LeFou hails a BARMAID and buys everyone a round of drinks The villagers raise their mugs and cheer. LEFOU/VILLAGERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My what a guy, that Gaston! Gaston stands, and clasps LeFou in gratitude... GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I needed encouragement; thank you, LeFou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's no one as easy to bolster as you! ... only to find himself in an uncomfortably tight hug. LEFOU (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much?                                               GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.                                                    VILLAGERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one fights like Gaston Douses lights like Gaston! LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a wrestling match nobody bites like Gaston! LeFou moves his shirt up his arm to show an old wrestling a nice teeth impression courtesy of Gaston. The villagers GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I hunt, I sneak up with my quiver And beasts of the field say a prayer First I carefully aim for the liver Then I shoot from behind! Gaston leaps onto the bar, and is handed a huge blunderbu with which he mimes shooting LeFou. LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that fair? GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care And Gaston fires the rifle into the ceiling!   Plaster ra down. VILLAGERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one hits like Gaston Matches wits like Gaston LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a spitting match nobody spits like Gaston GASTON

dialogues.speaker: I'M ESPECIALLY GOOD AT EXPECTORATING
dialogues.text: Gaston spits a big gloppy mess into a spittoon: bullseye! he moves around the inn, holding court. VILLAGERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten points for Gaston!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a lad I ate four dozen eggs Ev'ry morning to help me get large On one shoulder, Gaston lifts a pretty VILLAGE GIRL.   On other, he lifts LeFou. GASTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now that I'm grown I eat five dozen eggs So I'm roughly the size of a barge! The crowd hollers. Gaston jumps on a long table. The tabl height plus his massive frame make him seem 10 feet tall. He engages in a dance-break sword-fight with several VILL MEN, besting them all, until he's perfectly positioned be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ceiling mural, mimicking it exactly: Gaston, saber raised victorious in battle -- with LeFou swooning at his feet. LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who has brains like Gaston? Entertains like Gaston? GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who can make up these endless Refrains like Gaston? Gaston tromps on the table.   He arrives at his WALL OF A HEADS and ANTLERS. GASTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I use antlers in all of my decorating! ALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it again - who's a man among men? And let's say it once more Who's that hero next door? Who's a super success? Don't you know? Can't you guess? Ask his fans and his five hangers-on There's just one guy in town Who's got all of it down... LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And his name's `G-A-S-T... ' Uh, I believe there's another `T' in there, it just occurred to me that I'm                          illiterate and I've never actually had to spell it out loud before... Gaston! The villagers cheer as Gaston returns to his seat.   Gast

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeFou on the shoulder, genuinely moved. GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah LeFou, you're the best. How is it                     that no girl has snatched you up yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been told I'm clingy, but I really                 don't get it...                                         Just then, the door flies open to reveal a wild-eyed Maur MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Somebody help me! We have to go... not a minute to lose... TAVERN KEEPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa.   Slow down, Maurice. MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got Belle... locked in a dungeon! TAVERN KEEPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's got her? MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beast... a horrible monstrous beast! The patrons begin to laugh. MAURICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter's life is in danger, why do you laugh!? His castle is hidden in the woods. It's already winter there! JEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter in June?                                         CLOTHILDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy old Maurice. MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast is real! Do you understand?!                  Will no one help me?! GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ever the opportunist) I'll help you, Maurice!                                 LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will? The villagers murmur in surprise. GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winks at LeFou) Everyone! Stop making fun of this man at once! Maurice approaches.   So grateful. MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Captain.   Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't thank me, Maurice.    Lead us to the beast. Maurice exits.   Gaston follows, gesturing to LeFou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally getting it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The staff is excited as they scramble to get ready for di CHIP, the 8 year-old tea cup, rides his saucer around lik skateboard. He circles his teapot mother MRS. POTTS, a no nonsense yet loving governess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama, there's a girl in the castle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Chip.     We know. Slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she pretty? Is she nice?     What kind of tea does she like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find out soon enough. Slow down before you break your handle! But Chip doesn't slow down. Before Mrs. Potts can chase, CUISINIГ€R, the frustrated French chef-turned-oven, pours water into her to prepare tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heads up, Mrs. Potts!                                     She flushes and reacts with pleasure as if stepping into bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast enters the dining room and sits at one end of a long dining table. He looks at his place setting, surpris to find flatware and crystal. Confused, he looks up. THE BEAST'S POV rises to find another place setting at th other end of the long table. When he notices the romantic candles, he swats his own place setting off the table in anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A voice bellowing from the dining room causes Lumiere and Cogsworth to turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BEAST (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: LUMI
dialogues.text: Cogsworth balks with terror. LUMIГ€RE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be calm, let me do the talking. A fuming beast storms in, and looks down at the assembled staff. LumiГЁre is as good a liar as Cogsworth is not. THE BEAST

dialogues.speaker: YOU'RE MAKING HER DINNER
dialogues.text: LUMIГ€RE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thought you might appreciate the                      company.                                                 COGSWORTH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master, I can assure you that I had no part in this hopeless plan. Preparing                    a dinner, designing a gown for her,                      giving her a suite in the east wing --                   THE BEAST

dialogues.speaker: YOU GAVE HER A BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Cornered by the beast, Cogsworth has no choice but to... COGSWORTH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no, he gave her a bedroom.                            LUMIГ€RE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is true. But if the girl is the                     one who can break the spell, maybe you can start by using dinner to charm her. (turns to Cogsworth)                              Good thinking, Cogsworth!                                COGSWORTH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!                                                   THE BEAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the most ridiculous idea I've                     ever heard! "Charm the prisoner."                        LUMIГ€RE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must try, master. With every passing day, we become less human.                       THE BEAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the daughter of a common thief.                    What kind of person do you think that makes her? MRS. POTTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you can't judge people by who their father is, now can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a loaded statement. The staff cringes, ready for his retaliation. Instead, a grunt, and then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KNOCK. KNOCK. The beast stands at Belle's door while his servants stand by his side to play Cyrano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will join me for dinner!     That's not              a request.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gently, master. The girl lost her                        father and her freedom in one day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The poor thing is probably in there, scared to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, Belle has been actively planning her escape. He makeshift rope of fabric hangs 50 feet out of the window. KNOCK. KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The servants react to hearing Belle's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, there she is.    Now, master, remember. Be gentle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...kind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...charming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...sweet...                                              The words fly as they bury the beast with advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when she opens the door, give her a dashing debonair smile. Come come -- show me the smile. The beast flashes the most hideous grin anyone has ever s The staff GASPS in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh mon dieu.                                            Contorting his mouth, the beast turns back to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you join me for dinner? We wait a perfect beat and then, cut to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle moves to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've taken me prisoner and now you                    want to have dinner with me? Are you                    insane?                                                 The beast's temper rises -- his eyebrows twitch, his tail thrashes -- recognizing the signs, Plumette inches away -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's losing it... The beast beats his fist on the door -- WHAM!   WHAM!   W

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to come down to dinner. Belle hits back.    WHAM!   WHAM!   WHAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I told you no! All the banging finally wakes up Madame de Garderobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd starve before I ever ate with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well be my guest! Go ahead and starve!                  (as he leaves)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she doesn't eat with me, then she doesn't eat at all! The staff hides, terrified, as the beast thunders off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Idiots! Once the coast is clear, Cogsworth comes out of hiding wi sword and puts on a show of bravery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't talk to us like that! I forbid it! I... I... (to LumiГЁre)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I too late? Shame. I was really going to tell him off this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks past Cogsworth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh master, you've returned!                               Cogsworth shrieks and spins -- only to realize he's been duped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, very funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh, I got you there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuming, the beast returns to his lair -- a chamber of shr furniture and walls ruined in rage. He paces, muttering. grabs a decaying HAND MIRROR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me the girl. The mirror lights up and gives him a view of Belle at the bedroom door. She turns, slides down the wall, and curls knees up to her. A look of dread on her face. Her fear crushes the beast. The mirror magic fades, and h left with his own reflection and self-loathing. He lowers mirror to reveal the glass jar by the open window. In the jar, the ENCHANTED ROSE hangs in mid-air. The rose wilting. Most of its petals have fallen. Rage evaporating replaced by shame, the beast lowers his head... ... as ONE MORE PETAL DROPS. The image moves inside the jar. We see the beast through glass as he leans down, peering in at the petal as it rea the bottom and shrivels. As it does, we hear a far off RU as if the foundation of the castle is trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a distance, we see stone statuary crack and tumble d from the castle walls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The staff is gathered; the beginning of their evening. Lu lights the fireplace. He hears the crash of falling debri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another petal fell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LumiГЁre, I grew three more feathers!                     And I just plucked yesterday.                            LumiГЁre moves to help, but his legs stiffen.    He holds to his knee like a heating pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, darling -- Ow! I'm getting                       more metallic every day.                                 Suddenly, Cogsworth begins making clock sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no! It's -- tick tock! -- happening again -- cuckoo! Pardon me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone, calm yourselves.    We still have time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama, am I ever going to be a boy again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Chip.     You'll have your days in the              sun again.     You just leave it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle throws her makeshift rope out the bedroom window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle looks down -- the rope is about 20 feet off the gro Almost there. A KNOCK on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, dear. It's only Mrs.                        Potts. Mrs. Potts bustles in on her cart with Chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, aren't you a vision! How lovely                      to make your acquaintance.                               Belle tries to block her view of the escape rope, but Mrs is too sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. POTTS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a very long journey. Let me fix                      you up before you go. I have found that most troubles seem less troubling after a bracing cup o' tea.                               The tea is poured into Chip, who wheels over to Belle. MRS. POTTS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly now, Chip. Belle picks up Chip and brings him up to her mouth. Littl Chip finds himself face-to-face with the most beautiful g he has ever seen. She takes a sip. CHIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleased to meet you!    Want to see me do                 a trick? Chip blows a huge bubble in his tea cup.     It pops loud MRS. POTTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip.                                                     (to Belle) That was a very brave thing you did for your father, dear. Madame Garderobe's doors swing open. GARDEROBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    We all think so.                                  BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so worried about him.      He's never                 been on his own.                                          MRS. POTTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheer up, my poppet. Things will turn                     out in the end. You'll feel a lot better after dinner. BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he said, "If she doesn't eat with me, she doesn't eat at all." MRS. POTTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People say a lot of things in anger. It is our choice whether or not to listen. Coming?                                                   And Mrs. Potts is out the door.      Belle looks to Garde GARDEROBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens.   LumiГЁre races in to the excited staff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUMIГ€RE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming! Final checks,                            everyone, tout de suite!                                 Cogsworth waddles in after him.   Plumette flutters nervo COGSWORTH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't! If the master finds out you violated his orders and fed her, he will blame me. Lumiere jumps up onto the sink, navigating sudsy dishes a CHAPEAU scrubs them. LUMIГ€RE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I will make sure of it. But did                     you see her stand up to him? I am telling you, this girl is the one. They must fall in love if we are to be human again, and they can't fall in love if she stays in her room. (looks at a smudged dish) Eh, Chapeau, you missed a spot!                          LumiГЁre tosses the dish back in the sink, skipping onto passing tea trolley. Cogsworth climbs up in pursuit. COGSWORTH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know she will never love him. LUMIГ€RE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A broken clock is right two times a                      day, mon ami, and this is not one of                     those times.                                             LumiГЁre leaps onto the table, and uprights a champagne g LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand up straight!                                       (to the room)                                        It's time to sparkle!                                    He leaps again, onto CUISINIГ€R, and sips a spoonful from bubbling pot. LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no taste buds, but I can tell                     this is exquisite.                                       CUISINIГ€R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off! Off me while I work! Pepper,                        get cracking! Salt, shake a leg!                         COGSWORTH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so loud! Keep it down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, of course. But what is dinner without a little... music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Cogsworth's horror, LumiГЁre guides an ambulatory HARP into the room. This is CADENZA, our neurotic Italian maes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maestro Cadenza, are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has been so long since I've performed! I can barely even remember                   how...                                                  But with an abrupt flourish, Cadenza plays show-offy scal on the ivories until -- PLUNK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another cavity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maestro, your wife is upstairs, finding                 it harder and harder to stay awake.                     She's counting on you to help us break                  this curse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, I shall play through the dental                   pain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Cadenza)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Maestro. Play quietly. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quietly? Sotto voce? Of course. Are                     there any other tasteless demands you                   wish to make upon my artistry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's it.                                          Mrs. Potts leads Belle to the end of the long dining tabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are, dear.                                    LumiГЁre LEAPS onto the table. Floating at a high window, Plummette uses a silver platter to turn a shaft of moonli into a SPOTLIGHT. As LumiГЁre begins "BE OUR GUEST."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUMIГ€RE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma chere, mademoiselle. It is with deepest pride and greatest pleasure that we welcome you tonight. And now, we invite you to relax. Belle sits down in a chair, which moves in, bringing her closer to the table. LumiГЁre motions up to Plumette to steady her shaky spotlight. LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us pull up a chair... as the dining room proudly presents... Cadenza plays a dramatic scale as a table cloth UNFURLS, LumiГЁre jumps up and LANDS in a pose. Cadenza ends his s the wrong note. LumiГЁre shoots him a look, Cadenza plays right note, and LumiГЁre turns to Belle and smiles. LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... your dinner. (sings to Belle) Be our guest, be our guest The napkins on the place settings rise up and twirl.   Ch offers Belle a napkin. LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
