dialogues.text: Put our service to the test Tie your napkin `round your neck, cherie And we provide the rest! Spinning quickly, Chapeau presents the following to Belle LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soup du jour, hot hors d'oeuvres Why we only live to serve Try the grey stuff, it's delicious Belle reaches out to try it, but it's gone before she can LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't believe me? Ask the dishes! The hors d'oeuvres plates go off, leaving the dinner dish levitate and spin. LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can sing, they can dance After all, miss, this is France! A small guillotine on the table drops, slicing the baguet MENUS fly in overhead, buzzing a disgruntled Cogsworth. B reaches up and grabs one. LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a dinner here is never second best Go on unfold your menu (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUMIГЁRE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a glance and then you'll Be our guest, be our guest LUMIГ€RE AND COGSWORTH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be our guest! Cogsworth shushes LumiГЁre, and LumiГЁre jabs him back. one the kitchen doors swing open, presenting: LUMIГ€RE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beef ragout, cheese souffle, Pie and pudding en flambГ©! The fish pie explodes! A piece of cod hits Cogsworth in t face, knocking him over. LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll prepare and serve with flair A culinary cabaret! Flute glasses fill up with champagne and then break into Fosse homage. Belle grabs a glass, but LumiГЁre snatches before she sips. LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're alone and you're scared But the banquet's all prepared! LumiГЁre coaxes the flatware to its feet. LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's gloomy or complaining While the flatware's entertaining! The flatware hold out a napkin, into which LumiГЁre jumps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: trampoline. He is launched into the air, swinging between chandeliers a la Cirque du Soleil. LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tell jokes, I do tricks With my fellow candlesticks CHANDELIER CANDLESTICKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's all in perfect taste That you can bet! LumiГЁre falls and lands back in the middle of the champa flutes. They rise up around him. LUMIГ€RE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on and lift your glass You've won your own free pass To be our guest (to Cogsworth) If you're stressed, it's fine dining we suggest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oui our guest Be our guest, be our guest!                               Cogsworth steps back as LumiГЁre again takes center stage Martha Graham inspired solo. LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life is so unnerving For a servant who's not serving Belle reaches again for food but is stopped by LumiГЁre's melodramatic histrionics. He wraps himself in a napkin fo the full Martha Graham effect. LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not whole Without a soul to wait upon LumiГЁre does a `tragic walk' down the table. Reaching th he slides down to the floor on the tablecloth, then gathe around his neck and continues on. Belle tries to stab a bite as the food moves past her, as a conveyer belt. Sliding past her, Cogsworth wobbles. On the floor, snow swirls around LumiГЁre. We pull out to several "ETTES" flinging salt at him to create the effect LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, those good old days when we were useful Suddenly, those good old days are gone Reaching the end of the table, plates dive and spin into piles -- LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too long we've been rusting Needing so much more than dusting Needing exercise A chance to use our skills -- while Cogsworth lands on LumiГЁre's lap below. Chapeau

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: them both up and drops them back on the table before Bell LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most days we just lay around the castle Flabby, fat and lazy LumiГЁre playfully pokes Cogsworth in his pot belly -- th takes a flying leap! LUMIГ€RE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You walked in, and oops-a-daisie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Potts hops along the edge of the sink basin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a guest, it's a guest! Sakes alive, and I'll be blessed! Wine's been poured and thank the Lord I've had more napkins freshly pressed! She ascents to the top of a tiered, circular pastry table napkins twirl around her. Desserts appear and circle Mrs. Potts. Then tea cups enter on the outer circle, moving in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With dessert, she'll want tea And my dear, that's fine with me! While the cups do their soft shoeing, I'll be bubbling, I'll be brewing! From overhead, a la Busby Berkeley, we reveal desserts, t napkins, the floor, everything circling in opposing direc Mrs. Potts descends, jumping onto her tea trolley -- and a smudge of icing on Chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get warm, piping hot Heaven's sake, is that a spot? She quickly steams it off him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean it up, we want the company impressed! The trolley rolls through the doors --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and up to Belle.   Mrs. Potts pours a cup into Chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a lot to do -- Is it one lump or two? For you our guest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's our guest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's our guest!                                         Finally, unable to resist, Cogsworth joins in, pushing LumiГЁre out of the spotlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's our guest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plumette and her "Ettes" descend on a chandelier, which i lowered by LumiГЁre. They dance; a BeyoncГ© homage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be our guest! Be our guest! Our command is your request! It's years since we had anybody Here and we're obsessed! LumiГЁre ties the chandelier rope around Cogsworth, who f over, causing the light to spin. Plumette dives into a ma punch bowl, leading her "Ettes" into an Esther Williams m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your meal, with your ease, Yes indeed, we aim to please Splashes from the punch bowl launch us into a "Singin' in Rain" moment, with LumiГЁre dancing under the fountain. T grand finale is pure Bollywood, punctuated by explosions candy-colored powders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the candlelight's still glowing, Let us help you, we'll keep going -- Course by... COURSE! One by one! Til you shout "Enough, I'm done!" Then we'll sing you off to sleep as you digest Tonight you'll prop your feet up But for now let's eat up... Be our guest! Be our guest! Be our guest! Please! Be our guest!! As the table clears itself, whooshing back into the kitch LumiГЁre whirls toward Belle, finally presenting her with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pudding?! Overwhelmed, she laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Potts (on her trolley cart) escorts Belle from the d room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surely you're as trapped here as I am.                    Don't you ever want to escape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The master's not as terrible as he                        appears. Somewhere deep in his soul,                      there's a prince of a fellow, just                        waiting to be set free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle takes this in, a valuable piece of the puzzle.   Sh looks up at the massive staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lumiere mentioned something about the                     West Wing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never you mind about that.   Off to bed                   with you, poppet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nighty-night. Straight to bed!                            Mrs. Potts moves off as Belle climbs the stairs toward he room. At the top, she hurries up the staircase leading to the west wing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle sticks to the shadows.   She walks up to a massive door -- slightly ajar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furniture lies in rubble, curtains are shredded -- eviden the beast's temper. Wary, Belle investigates when -- SHE GLIMPSES EYES PEERING AT HER OFF TO THE SIDE. With a start, Belle wheels to find -- the eyes belong to portrait. The subject seems to be a TEENAGE BOY but his f has been SLASHED BEYOND RECOGNITION. Only the eyes survived. Bright blue. Engaging. Resembling eyes of THE BEAST. She realizes that this is the "prince fellow" Mrs. Potts was referring to. Belle leans in to study the painting. A ROYAL FAMILY stan the castle. The FATHER's image has been slashed. The QUEE remains pristine. Kind. Beautiful. Belle moves past a large four-poster bed, its faded cover gray with dust, like no one has slept in it for years. On the floor, she sees a makeshift bed made of straw, torn b of fabric and crumpled blankets: the resting place of a nocturnal carnivore. Belle turns and sees the glow coming from the GLASS JAR b open window leading to the balcony. Inside the jar -- THE ENCHANTED ROSE. Mesmerized, Belle approaches the rose. She lifts the jar, leaving the rose unprotected. She reaches out to touch th rose. A shadow cuts across Belle's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT ARE YOU DOING HERE!?    WHAT DID YOU DO TO IT!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast bears down on Belle, backing her up.   She puts the bell jar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DO YOU REALIZE WHAT YOU COULD HAVE DONE!? YOU COULD HAVE DAMNED US ALL! GET OUT! GO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle runs.   The beast turns and covers the rose, panick protective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LumiГЁre and Cogsworth play chess on an upper landing, wi Froufrou resting between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checkmate.     Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you cheated.     Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle appears, racing down the west wing staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle... what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cogsworth jumps onto the chess board as Lumiere hops to t floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go go, Froufrou!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Froufrou jumps up and starts after Belle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Froufrou, stop her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle barrels down the main staircase, Froufrou in close pursuit. Mrs. Potts enters from the kitchen, wearing a tea cosy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to go out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the stairs, Cogsworth sounds a whistle. cuts, WINDOWS drop and SHUTTERS close. Belle hits the bottom of the grand staircase and runs tow the door -- only to watch it bolt itself locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop her! Froufrou runs in front of Belle to block her exit, and gr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's a good dog? Then suddenly, his growls turn to playful yaps, as he sta on his hind legs and pants playfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No, it's not playtime!      Bad dog! Bad dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What part of `stop her' don't you understand, dog?! Froufrou spins and scrambles outside, scooting through th low postern door within the great front door. In his excitement, he's provided Belle with an escape! Belle snatches her cloak from a bewildered Chapeau, and shimmies out through this same `doggie door.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, don't go! It's dangerous! Mrs. Potts rushes forward but it's too late.      A look settles on her face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOWL. Philippe's hooves hit the snowy landscape.   Belle through the woods. She looks back to see if the beast fol her. She only sees a glimpse of the castle. She thinks sh escaped. Surely, she has escaped. WOLVES HOWL NEARBY. ANGLE ON PHILIPPE'S MUDDY HOOFPRINT -- a WOLF'S PAW smash over the print -- the wolf howls --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON BELLE -- out of the corner of her eye, she sees OF A DOZEN WHITE WOLVES flitting through the trees, closi on her. Belle forges on -- the wolves are not bothering to hide a they've emerged from the trees to take down their prey -- closing in fast -- -- Belle pushes through the undergrowth to find she has r a FROZEN POND. Philippe doesn't hesitate. He gallops onto ice, and across the pond. The sound of ice CRACKING under hooves is deep and low. And increasing. Philippe's hooves slide on the ice.   The wolves close in Philippe makes it across the pond onto land.   But before Belle can feel any relief -- A WOLF'S JAWS snap at Philippe's thigh. Then another. The horse bucks wildly -- causing Belle to makes a controlled leap onto a snow bank. She seizes a thick branch and wiel it as a club -- as the wolves surround her, jaws slaverin Belle swings her club as one wolf lunges at her, its bare teeth like razors. She beats it away. She turns to confro another -- it bites the branch clean out of her hands. Belle turns, looks up -- on a rock promontory, the scarre ALPHA WOLF is about to take a diving leap onto her. It jumps, and she flinches -- but just as the wolf is about makes its horrible landing --

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST APPEARS --
dialogues.text: -- and catches it in mid-air! With supernatural force, th beast hurls the wolf across the frozen pond, howling! All the wolves dive on the beast at once, tearing shreds his cloak. He strikes at them -- wolves scurry, yelping - The oversize ALPHA WOLF climbs onto the beast's back, goe for his neck. The beast slams together the wolves on his arms, dropping them -- then reaches back and seizes the Alpha. WOLF and BEAST snarl inches from each other -- the beast squeezes -- Then hurls the Alpha into a stone ledge -- CRACK -- knock out. The remaining pack retreats in panic, their yelps ec through the trees. TIGHT ON BELLE -- watching as the beast whimpers in pain. shoulders slump. He collapses in the snow. This is her ch Belle could run. She looks past Philippe, to the woods -- freedom. But then turns back, and slowly approaches the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: beast. Belle covers the beast with her blanket.   He stirs.   On opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to help me... you have to stand...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The beast is slumped across Philippe's saddle. As Belle t the reins and begins the long walk back to the castle, we into the sky, where we can see the border that separates enchanted woods from the outside world, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOLVES HOWL. Gaston's carriage moves through the scary wo LeFou squeezed in back behind Gaston and Maurice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I'm sure this is the way! Do you                    hear those wolves? That means we're                     getting very close to the castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, enough is enough.   We have to turn               back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!   That's it!                                      Maurice points up ahead to the WITHERED TREE that looks l ELDERLY PERSON'S CANE -- THE TREE IS STANDING AGAIN, the of trees now hidden behind it. Maurice hops down from the wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the tree. I'm sure of it. Of                     course, it was downed by lightning at                   the time, but now it's been restored                    to an upright position, through some                    sort of... magic. Or other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto to Gaston)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really want to marry into this family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that means the castle is definitely                  that way!                                               An angry Gaston steps out and approaches Maurice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done playing this game of yours. Where is Belle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast took her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no such things as beasts, or                  talking teacups, or... magic! But there                 are wolves, frostbite, and starvation.                  LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep breaths, Gaston.   Deep breaths.                   GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why don't we just turn around go back                to Villeneuve? I'm sure Belle is at                     home, cooking up a lovely dinner...                     MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think I've made all this up,                     then why did you offer to help?                         GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I want to marry your daughter! Now let's go home. MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle is not at home!   She's with the --               GASTON

dialogues.speaker: FEED YOU TO THE WOLVES
dialogues.text: Gaston holds his fist to strike Maurice across the face. LeFou runs over to intervene. LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GASTON! STOP! Breathe. Think happy                      thoughts. Go back to the war. Blood,                    explosions, countless widows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Widows...                                               LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, that's it, that's it...                       LeFou's voice snaps Gaston out of his rage.    He puts on Gaston smile like a Halloween mask. GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, forgive me, old bean. That's no                 way to talk to my future father-in-law,                 now is it? MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Future father-in-law...?   You will never               marry my daughter.                                      A beat.   Without a word, Gaston hits Maurice, knocking h LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw that coming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice is now tied to a tree. Gaston secures the knot an walks to the carriage. Darkness has come over Gaston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Maurice won't give me his blessing, then he is in my way. Once the wolves are finished with him, Belle will have no one to take care of her but me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the sake of exhausting all of our options, do we maybe want to consider a less gruesome alternative? Gaston climbs into the carriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you coming? LeFou looks back to Maurice, an apology in his eyes.   He climbs into the carriage. Gaston and LeFou ride off, leaving Maurice to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast lies in his old human bed. Belle dabs a large g on the beast's arm. The beast bares his fangs and lets ou roar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROOOOAARRRR! Ow! That hurts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you held still, it wouldn't hurt as much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you hadn't run away, none of this would have happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if you hadn't frightened me, I wouldn't have run away. The household staff anxiously watches the battle of words

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you shouldn't have been in the west wing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you should learn to control your temper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast is momentarily silenced. Belle looks down at th wound she has been dabbing. It's worse than she thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to get some rest.                                     The beast's breath slows to a low rumble as his eyes slip shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are eternally grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you care so much about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've looked after him all his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he has cursed you somehow.                            (off their silence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? You did nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're quite right there, dear. You                       see, when the master lost his mother,                     and his cruel father took that sweet                      innocent lad and twisted him up to be                     just like him... we did nothing.                          Belle notes their shame just as we HEAR the first notes o beautiful melody coming from the ballroom downstairs. Thi the beast's lullaby -- "DAYS IN THE SUN."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him sleep.                                            As the staff and Belle exit, the beast stirs. We move fro his face, shivering in a fever dream, to discover --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The YOUNG PRINCE gazes down sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Days in the sun                                           When my life has barely begun                             We move around to reveal that he is looking at the pale b of THE QUEEN on her deathbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until my own life is done                             Will I ever leave you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the prince, a figure approaches: his FATHER. Cruel written on his face. Placing his large hand on the boy's shoulder, he pulls him out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the gloomy ballroom, Cadenza plays the beautiful melod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will I tremble again                                    To my dear one's gorgeous refrain?                      The melody drifts through the ballroom until we find Lumi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plumette, dancing: LUMIГ€RE & PLUMETTE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you now forever remain                             Out of reach of my arms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drifting to Mrs. Potts and Chip, as she tucks him into be the cupboard:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh those days in the sun                                What I'd give to relive just one                        Undo what's done                                        And bring back the light                                The melody wafts up to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame de Garderobe joins in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O I could sing                                          Of the pain these dark days bring                       The spell we're under                                   Still it's the wonder of us                             I sing of tonight                                       Belle turns to the window, sings:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How in the midst of all this sorrow                     Can so much hope and love endure?                       I was innocent and certain                              Now I'm wiser but unsure

dialogues.speaker: BELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can't go back into my            Days in the past childhood                          Ah those precious days One that my father made            couldn't last secure                             Oh - hold me closer I can feel the change in me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm stronger now but still not free

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the window, we PAN across to the castle, to the hori - where the sun is rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast's eyes are closed as he feels his mother's hand his head one more time. The whole staff looks on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Days in the sun Will return - we must believe As lovers do That days in the sun Will come shining through The beast opens his eyes weakly, takes in the low light o sunrise. As his vision adjusts, the silhouetted figure by his bedside is revealed. Not his mother, but Belle. A smi forms on his lips, and he closes his eyes again. In the glass jar, a petal drops as if floating on the mel Belle crosses to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens when the last petal falls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The master remains a beast forever.     And the rest of us become...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Antiques.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knickknacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightly used houseware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubbish.    We become rubbish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to help you. There must be some way to lift the curse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The staff exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there is one --                                    LumiГЁre candle-smacks him, leaving a waxy smear on his f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not for you to worry about, lamb. We've made our bed and we must lie in                    it. The BEAST opens his eyes, he's been listening. The years shame and anguish haunt his face as he begins to remember it is to be human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice sleeps. Suddenly, we hear the branches crack arou him. The sound gets closer, and just when we think that w have found Maurice, we see -- A HOODED FIGURE emerges from the woods. The figure looks Maurice, his breathing making fog in the cold. Alarmed, t figure rushes up and pulls down the hood to reveal -- AGATHE.   The beggar woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agathe, her arm around Maurice, guides him into a shelter small clearing. Gently, she lays him down and removes her cloak, spreading it over him for warmth. She pulls a bundle off her back and rifles through it, re herbs, a mortar and pestle, and expertly whips up a conco that she brings to Maurice's lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink. He blinks, reviving, as he drinks it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you... Agathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast lies in bed, still bandaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love can transpose to form and                           dignity. Love looks not with the eyes                    but with the mind. And therefore --                      He opens his eyes to see that Belle isn't reading, she's reciting from memory. He joins in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And therefore is winged Cupid painted                 blind.                                                Belle looks up, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you know Shakespeare?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had an expensive education.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, "Romeo and Juliet" is my                    favorite play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is that not a surprise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that heartache and pining and --                  (a beastly shudder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are so many better things to                    read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?                                            The beast smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast has lead Belle into the biggest grandest privat library in all of France. The chamber is vast and lined f to ceiling with books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should be something here you can start                with...                                               He turns to see Belle, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Yes, I suppose it is... Well, if                  you like it so much, then it's yours.                 The beast starts to leave.     He is stopped by --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you really read every one of these books?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not all of them. Some are in Greek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that a joke?   Are you making jokes                   now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.                                                    Belle shakes her head but is also charmed.    The beast t and strides out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast eats at the table, reading a book which sits on stand. He looks up to see Belle sit at the other end with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: books. She picks up her spoon and starts to eat. The beas plants his face in the bowl. Looks up a second later havi inhaled the soup, half of which is dripping from his fur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: attempts a smile. "SOMETHING THERE" begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle and the beast cross a stone footbridge. She reads aloud to the patient, who moves tentatively, favoring a wounded leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air is blue and keen and cold                         And in a frozen sheath enrolled                           The beast stops.   Belle, savoring the words, keeps walki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each branch, each twig, each blade of                     grass                                                     Seems clad miraculously with glass                        Belle notices that she's walking alone.   She turns back, the beast staring out soulfully:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel as if I'm seeing it for the                        first time.                                               As she follows his gaze, we reveal a splendidly desolate landscape. The very thing Belle has just described, now spread out before her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there more?                                            Belle smiles, pleased that for a moment at least he's bec a fan of poetry. She reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But in that solemn silence                              Is heard the whisper                                    Of every sleeping thing:                                "Look, look at me                                       Come wake me up                                         For still here I be."                                   Belle meets the beast's eyes.   Both suddenly aware of hi meanings in the poet's words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the fresh snow, Belle brushes Philippe's coat. The bea looks at Belle -- she nods -- and he pets the horse. Phil reacts skittishly, causing the beast to withdraw. Belle t his hand and places it on Philippe. Then, as she turns aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something sweet and almost kind But he was mean and he was coarse and unrefined She looks back -- sees the beast petting Philippe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now he's dear and so unsure I wonder why I didn't see it there before Suddenly, a snowball hits the beast.   He turns to see Be smiling. The beast builds a huge snowball, and hurls it at Belle. knocks her clean off her feet and into the snow. Off the beast, grinning in delight --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle reads at her end of the long dining table. She look and sees the beast looking at her. "May I?" She nods, goe back to her book. As he walks the length of the table:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glanced this way I thought I saw And when we touched She didn't shudder at my paw No, it can't be I'll just ignore But then she's never looked at me that way before The beast sits. He grabs his bowl and slurps down the sou then catches himself as he sees Belle watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, she picks up her bowl and drinks the soup same way. The beast smiles. They loudly slurp and laugh together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plumette and several Ettes remove dust bags from the chandeliers, as Belle stands on a balcony, sleeves rolled She scrubs a dirty window, causing a beam of sunlight to strike Cadenza. Meanwhile Chapeau mops the floor, cleanin off years of grime, revealing the shiny marble underneath

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New and a bit alarming Who'd have ever thought that this could be? Through the cleaned windows she sees the beast outside, walking Philippe -- and talking to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True that he's no Prince Charming But there's something in him that I simply didn't see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle stands on a ladder, pulling down book after book, a handing them to the beast. The staff watches from the cor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, who'd have thought?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, bless my soul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, who'd have known?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, who indeed? The towering stack in the beast's arms teeters until the TABLE scoots up behind him, allowing him to set the stack The beast nods gratefully, and the wizened GLOBE on the t nods back. As the staff moves away:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who'd have guessed They'd come together on their own?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so peculiar, wait and see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll wait and see! A few days more

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There may be something there that wasn't there before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, perhaps there's something there that wasn't there before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, mama?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There may be something there that wasn't there before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, what's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you when you're older. Chip waits a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm older!                                        Mrs. Potts laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Chip, you are a one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting in the beautiful rose garden, the beast looks up his book as Belle approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you reading?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.                                                He hides the book but Belle catches the title.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guinevere and Lancelot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well actually, King Arthur and the                      Round Table. Knights, and men, and                      swords and things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But still... it's a romance.                            The beast nods, a bit shyly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.     I felt like a change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never thanked you for saving my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I never thanked you... for not leaving me to be eaten by wolves. Belle laughs. A quiet charged moment, which ends with the SHOUTS and LAUGHTER of the servants in the castle. Belle the beast can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They know how to have a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But when I enter the room, laughter dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. The villagers say that I'm a "funny girl," but I don't think they mean it as a compliment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.     Your village sounds terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost as lonely as your castle. He turns to her with a melancholy smile.       Then, an i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say we run away? Belle is surprised by the suggestion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast unlocks a desk cabinet. In it, resting on velve its gold-leaf cover faintly glimmering with magic, is a LEATHER BOUND BOOK covered in a thick layer of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another little "gift" from the Enchantress... The beast cracks open the book to reveal AN ANTIQUE WORLD ATLAS. No countries. Just land and sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A book that truly allows you to escape. Belle moves closer to find the pen and ink drawing is ali Waves lap the beaches. Green trees sway in invisible wind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was her cruelest trick of all. The outside world has no place for a creature like me. But it can for you. The beast offers his hand and Belle takes it.    He gentl moves her hand to the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of the place you've most wanted to see. First, see it in your mind's eye. Now feel it in your heart. Belle nods -- this isn't a difficult decision. The moment her hand hits the page, we ENTER it, SPINNING through celestial flares -- which blur and recombine -- as the li of Paris. We descend over the city and into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the top floor of a windmill in Montmartre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you take us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris. The beast looks out of a window and sees glittering light

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I love Paris. What would you like to see first? Notre Dame? The Champs- ElysГ©es? No? Too touristy? He turns to find Belle silent.   Her eyes brimming with t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so much smaller than I imagined. The beast watches Belle walk through her childhood home.. the artist's garret that Maurice recreated in his signatu music box. Abandoned years ago, the room is crumbling. Belle finds the remains of her father's easel. A tarnishe wall mirror. Her own broken crib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Paris of my childhood These were the borders of my life In this crumbling dusty attic Where an artist loved his wife I thought that I would find an answer Here where his heart has always lived

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I see it's empty and abandoned Easy to remember Harder to move on Knowing that the Paris of my childhood Is gone Belle notices something tucked into a corner of the crib. She pries it loose. It is a BABY'S RATTLE carved into the shape of a rose. The beast focuses on it. THE BEAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your mother?                             BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the only story Papa could never bring himself to tell. And I knew                         better than to ask...                                     As she speaks, the beast notices something on a chair. dark, pointed mask of a plague doctor. He looks up. THE BEAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plague. The revelation lands on Belle's face.   She looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle glimpses what must have happened. A DOCTOR stands i the doorway, his face covered by the mask. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must leave. Now.                                      A bag is hastily packed, Belle's YOUNGER FATHER (barely s taking only what is necessary. He stops to gaze at Belle' MOTHER, who lies on her deathbed, surrounded by medicines BELLE'S MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly... before it takes her too...                     She closes her eyes, turns away. Maurice picks up the baby... who drops her beloved rose- shaped rattle. Belle's mother touches it to her lips as husband and child disappear.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE PRESENT
dialogues.text: Belle stares at the rattle. THE BEAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sorry I ever called your father a                    thief.                                                    Belle lifts her head, her wet eyes look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go home. She means the castle.   The beast nods, takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind and rain dance in front of the inn.   MUSIC and DRUN LAUGHTER inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, this is some storm. At least                        we're not tied to a tree in the middle                   of nowhere, right? You know it's not                     too late, we could just go get him...                    Gaston doesn't react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just, every time I close my eyes,                   I picture Maurice stranded out there.                    And then when I open them, he's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter and see MAURICE surrounded by Pere Robert and the potter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice!                                                 LeFou realizes he shouldn't be happy and tamps down his smile. Maurice and Gaston lock eyes. Gaston quickly assesses the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston, did you try to kill Maurice? Just when we think Gaston might run or fight or deny, he warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Maurice! Thank heavens. I've spent                   the last five days trying to find you.                   Suddenly, the villagers shift their gaze to Maurice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! You tried to kill me!    You left                    me for the wolves!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice, it's one thing to rave about your delusions. It's another to accuse me of attempted murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston's argument lands.    The gentle Maurice feels the slipping away from him. JEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice, do you have any proof of what                  you're saying?                                          MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask Agathe! She rescued me! Before Agathe can speak -- GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agathe? You'd hang your accusation on the testimony of a filthy hag?                          (to Agathe) No offense, Agathe.                                     Agathe raises an eyebrow - but says nothing. MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monsieur LeFou! He was there.     He saw it all. LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?                                                     GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. Don't take my word for it. He puts his arm around LeFou and pulls him close. GASTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeFou, my dearest companion, did I,                     your oldest friend and most loyal                       compatriot, try to kill the father of                   the only woman I've ever loved? All eyes turn to LeFou, who is clearly torn. LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a complicated question on a                        number of accounts, but... no. No, he                   did not.                                                The crowd reacts. Maurice is crestfallen. Gaston has won. Maurice lunges at Gaston -- who catches his flying fist, subduing him. GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice, it pains me to say this, but you've become a danger to yourself and others. No wonder Belle ran away. You                   need help, sir. A place to heal your troubled mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston signals to Tom, Dick, and Stanley -- and Maurice t see them block the exit. Gaston places his large hand on Maurice's shoulder -- and squeezes. Maurice winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's going to be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast sits in a tub -- far too small for him.   There shadow-play on the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw her in the ballroom, and I said, well, you're making this so beautiful, we should have a dance tonight. I never thought she'd actually say yes! What was I thinking?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Master, it's perfect! The rose has only four petals left. Which means tonight... you must tell her how you feel. The beast stands, appearing above the curtain, sopping we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like a fool. She will never love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not be discouraged. The beast shakes his coat dry like a dog.   The spray extinguishes LumiГЁre's candles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you'd stop saying that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast plops into his a seat in front of the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You care for her, don't you? Well then, woo her with beautiful music and romantic candlelight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and when the moment's just right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how will I know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will feel slightly nauseous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, master, you'll do fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stop being a coward and tell                      Belle how you feel. And if you don't,                  I promise you'll be drinking cold tea                  for the rest of your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Covered in dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and very very dusty.                              Off the beast, taking this in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89A   A brief MONTAGE, as the castle staff give the beast

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bad makeover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start with the hair! Women love nice                   hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the fingers and toes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chapeau, brush those teeth!                            Chapeau wields scissors and a brush as Mrs. Potts pours h water into Chip. The beast is pushed and pulled, primped snipped. His fingers are dipped into Chip, his nails buff by Mrs. Potts' steam, as LumiГЁre climbs onto his horns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dip dip, snip snip...                                  Plumette powders the beast's face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes closed, poof poof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the piГЁce de rГ©sistance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chapeau places one of the Prince's old wigs on the beast. Plumette pecks his cheek with a beauty mark. The beast sp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: his chair to see himself in the mirror, and -- he's total ridiculous. The staff, dejected, takes in its handiwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, I can fix this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garderobe finishes dressing Belle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful.     But something is missing.                 Garderobe looks up. There's dust around the gilding that in the moonlight. A moment of inspiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, yes.     The finishing touch.                       Garderobe sweeps her arm, and the gold dust magically who down, settling on Belle's gown, and completing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle is breathtaking as she is revealed on the upper landing. Mustering his courage, the beast descends from the west w She gazes over at the beast, who looks resplendent. She s him in a new light. "BEAUTY AND THE BEAST" begins. From the bottom of the staircase, Mrs. Potts watches with Chip --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tale as old as time True as it can be Barely even friends Then somebody bends unexpectedly The beast and Belle meet on the center landing and descen staircase. Arm in arm, they enter --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the absolutely resplendent ballroom. It has been clean

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: scrubbed to its former glory. The great windows offer a magnificent view of the starry night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little change Small to say the least Both a little scared Neither one prepared Beauty and the Beast

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the music rises, Belle bows. The beast bows in return. offers him her hands -- and nervously, he takes them. The begin to dance, gliding across the ballroom -- CAMERA sweeps up to see CARVED INSTRUMENTAL FIGURES -- VIOLIN, VIOLAS, HARP -- which have come to life and are playing accompaniment with CADENZA -- sparkling with poli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever just the same Ever a surprise Ever as before Ever just as sure As the sun will rise Tale as old as time Tune as old as song Bittersweet and strange Finding you can change Learning you were wrong ANGLE ON BEAUTY AND THE BEAST -- in this moment, nothing world exists except each other. Despite his bulk, the bea careful, gentle, graceful. The lights in the ballroom gro as he lifts her, spinning. Belle is swept away. ANGLE ON THE HOUSEHOLD STAFF -- watching in mounting hope excitement. On top of Cadenza, LumiГЁre puts an arm aroun Cogsworth, pulling him closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certain as the sun Rising in the East Tale as old as time Song as old as rhyme Beauty and the Beast The lights come back up as the terrace doors open, allowi Belle and the beast to step outdoors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tale as old as   time Song as old as   rhyme Beauty and the   Beast Chip nuzzles his mother, as Belle and the beast move out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle and the beast stand together under the stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't danced in years.   I'd almost                 forgotten the feeling.                                  Mustering his courage --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's foolish,   I suppose, for a                          creature like   me to hope that one day                   he might earn   your affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? So you think you could be                         happy here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could anyone be happy if they're not                      free?                                                     She gazes wistfully toward the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father taught me to dance.   I used                    to step on his toes a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must miss him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks, decides)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle stares into the beast's hand mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to see my father.                                A glow of magic. When it clears Belle sees Maurice -- bei manhandled in the village square! He looks terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa!   What are they doing to him?!                      The beast reacts to her suffering.   A moment of choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pained)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must go to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must go to him. No time to waste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle looks at the beast as she has never done before -- gratitude and appreciation. She moves to return the mirro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Keep it with you. And you'll always have a way to look back on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. She rushes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle runs down the grand staircase towards the door. She stops, seeing Chapeau. He bows to her, silently, sadly. Choking back tears, she is gone. Chapeau looks up to the landing, and sees Mrs. Potts stan there, watching. Heartbroken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast unclasps his beautiful coat and lets it fall to ground. Cogsworth enters, eager for news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, master, I may have had my doubts, but everything is moving like clockwork. True love really does win the day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I let her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... WHAT!?                                           LumiГЁre and Plumette enter behind Cogsworth, followed by Potts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master... how could you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why? The beast doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he loves her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are we not human?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she doesn't love him!    And now, it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she might still come back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I've set her free. I'm sorry I                        couldn't do the same for all of you.                      He turns away, unable to face them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now go.     Our time is almost past.                      The staff retreats.    As "EVERMORE" begins, the beast pu a dark cape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I   was the one who had it all                            I   was the master of my fate                             I   never needed anybody in my life                       I   learned the truth too late

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps onto the balcony of his lair. From his POV, we s Belle mounting Philippe on the castle grounds below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never shake away the pain                            I close my eyes but she's still there                     I let her steal into my melancholy                        heart                                                     It's more than I can bear                                 Belle sets off and the beast begins to climb the castle turrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know she'll never leave me                          Even as she runs away                                     She will still torment me, calm me,                       hurt me, move me come what may                            The beast climbs higher and higher, to keep Belle in sigh she gets further and further away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasting in my lonely tower                                Waiting by an open door                                   I'll fool myself she'll walk right in                     And be with me for evermore                               The beast climbs, Belle riding, until he reaches the high turret of the castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I rage against the trials of love                         I curse the fading of the light                           Though she's already flown so far                         beyond my reach                                           She's never out of sight                                  Now I know she'll never leave me                          Even as she fades from view                               She will still torment me, be part of                     everything I do                                           Wasting in my lonely tower                                Waiting by an open door                                   I'll fool myself she'll walk right in                     And as the long long nights begin                         I'll think of all that might have been                    Waiting here for evermore                                 The beast stands at the edge of the turret as Belle final disappears through the castle gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horse-drawn asylum wagon thunders into the square where Maurice is surrounded by taunting villagers. The eerie driver, MONSIEUR D'ARQUE, steps out as Tom, Dick and Stan throw Maurice into his cage on wheels. Villagers approach the wagon like 18th century rubberneckers. Gaston leans into the wagon. The gathering crowd is just enough to mask a private plea to Maurice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen the inside of a mad house, Maurice? You wouldn't last a week. Just give me your daughter's                        hand, and I'll set you free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never.                                                    Gaston clenches his jaw and locks the door with a CLANK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him away! The wagon begins to move. The rubberneckers watch the wag until they are silenced by a loud...

dialogues.speaker: STOP
dialogues.text: Belle's voice cuts through the crowd.   They turn and gap BELLE, DAZZLING, IN HER EVENING GOWN. The crowd parts before her as she dismounts Philippe and moves to the wagon. They whisper as she passes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VILLAGERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Belle..." "Where did she come from?" "Is that Belle..." "Look at that dress..." Gaston stares, slack-jawed, unable to believe his eyes. W linger on the jealous village lasses, the puzzled Jean, t confused LeFou, the foul-tempered Clothilde, the bewilder Pere Robert, and in the shadows... Agathe. Belle fearlessly strides right in front of the wagon. The horses jump up, startled. Belle runs to the locked door. MAURICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle?   I thought I'd lost you!                         Belle sees her father injured on the floor of the wagon. BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open this door! He's hurt! Monsieur d'Arque climbs down to calm her. MONSIEUR D'ARQUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid we can't do that, miss.   But we'll take very good care of him.                        BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father's not crazy!   Gaston... Tell him! GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle, you know how loyal I am to your family, but your father has been making some unbelievable claims. JEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true, Belle. He's been raving about a beast in a castle. BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have just come from the castle and                     there is a beast!                                        GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all admire your devotion to your father, but you'd say anything to free him. Your word is hardly proof. Belle pulls out the magic mirror from her sash. BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want proof? SHOW ME THE BEAST!                       In the mirror, the beast sits slumped against a turret wa The villagers gasp. Gaston's face registers shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELLE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is your proof! GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is sorcery! Gaston snatches the mirror from Belle and holds it up to villagers. GASTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this beast. Look at his fangs,                   his claws.                                               The villagers recoil in fright. BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't be afraid.    He is gentle and kind. GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monster has put her under a spell!                   If I didn't know better, I'd say she even cared for him.                                      BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a monster, Gaston. You are.                     (appeals to everyone)                                The beast would never hurt anyone.                       GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have heard of the effects of dark                      magic, but never seen it with my own                     eyes before! This is a threat to our                     very existence!                                          Raucous cries of "Gaston Gaston Gaston!" rise.    Gaston the mirror up. GASTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the thugs)                                       We can't have her running off to warn                    the beast. Lock her up too.                              Tom, Dick and Stanley strong-arm Belle into the wagon wit her father. BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't over Gaston, you'll see!                      LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston, with all due respect --                          GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DO YOU WANT TO BE NEXT?    Fetch my                      horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston hops onto the back of the wagon and addresses the crowd. The "MOB SONG" begins as we move through the frightened villagers -- GASTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That creature will curse us all if we don't stop him! Well, I say we KILL

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAST
dialogues.text: TOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not safe until he's dead DICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll come stalking us at night JEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set to sacrifice our children To his monstrous appetite! CLOTHILDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll wreak havoc on our village If we let him wander free! GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's time to take some action, boys It's time to follow me! Gaston grabs a TORCH from a villager and tosses it into a of pitch. Flames rise to the sky. GASTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the mist, through the wood Through the darkness and the shadows It's a nightmare but it's one exciting ride Gaston lights Clothilde's torch, then clasps the shoulder Monsieur d'Arque, who watches helplessly as his asylum wa horses are commandeered by the mob. GASTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say a prayer, then we're there At the drawbridge of a castle And there's something truly terrible inside It's a beast, he's got fangs razor sharp ones Massive paws, killer claws for the feast Hear him roar, see him foam But we're not coming home `Til he's dead, good and dead...

dialogues.speaker: KILL THE BEAST
dialogues.text: Some villagers seize shovels, pitchforks, axes. Some ligh torches in the pitch. Others wrench a boar's head PIKE ST from outside the country inn. Pere Robert tries to calm t frenzy but the force of the mob pushes him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light your torch, mount your horse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw your courage to the sticking place

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're counting on Gaston to lead the way

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston and LeFou crash into the woods at a full gallop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it war                                              Call it threat                                           You can bet they all will follow                         For in times like this they'll do just                   as I say                                                 LeFou's doubts are growing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a beast Running wild there's no question But I fear The wrong monster's released

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sally forth, tally ho Grab your sword, grab your bow Praise the Lord and here we go! Gaston holds up the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me the castle! IN THE MIRROR -- Gaston sees the hidden path to the castl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plumette's head rests on LumiГЁre's shoulder.    Mrs. Pot Chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least he has finally learned to love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of good that does us if she doesn't love him in return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. This is the first time I've had any real hope she would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON CHIP -- he hears a distant sound -- the rumble o MARCHING BOOTS -- puzzled, he hops to the window embrasur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear that, mama?    Is it her!? Is she coming back?!                                    The staff and Froufrou jump up, excited, and move to the They see torches in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could it be? They look through the glass, distorted with frost, as the moves through the garden. LumiГЁre warms the windowpane w flame to see more clearly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sacrebleu!     Invaders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruffians!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there you go. So much for true                    love. Man the barricades, and hold                      fast!                                                   They hop down from the embrasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LumiГЁre, Cogsworth, Mrs. Potts, Chip, Plumette and Chape at the front door, forming a sad barricade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearts ablaze, banners high We go marching into battle -- Unafraid although the danger just increased

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move aside! Cadenza crab-walks in from the ballroom, standing vertica propping himself against the door. The others gather arou him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mob hauls their boar's head battering ram up to the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raise the flag, sing the song Here we come, we're fifty strong And fifty Frenchmen can't be wrong Let's kill the beast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH! The battering ram breaks through the postern door, which falls out of the door frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need help!                                            He lopes towards the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle gazes out the prison bars, sees d'Arque pacing by t fountain. She whispers to Maurice --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to warn the beast --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warn him?    How did you get away from                   him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He let me go, papa.     He sent me back                  to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.                                      She holds up the rose-shaped rattle.    Maurice recognize immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took me there. I know what                            happened to maman.                                       Maurice takes the rattle.   Stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you know I had to leave her                         there. I had to protect you. I've                        always tried to protect you... too                       much, perhaps...                                         He stops, eyes filled with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.                                            She takes his hand and kisses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you help me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   Yes it is.                                        Maurice sees the courage and determination in her eyes. his own eyes light up with an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I could try to pick the                        lock. After all, it's only gears and                     springs. But I would need something                      long and sharp --                                        He stops as Belle, a step ahead, removes and hands him on her long hairpins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like that.     Perfect.                                  Maurice gets to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cogsworth hops up the spiral staircase and out onto the turret. He spots the beast, perched among the gargoyles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me, master. I'm sorry to                          disturb you, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... the castle is under attack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter now.    Just let them                  come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battering ram smashes against the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill the beast!     Kill the beast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is giving way, the mob is too strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't working!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battering ram smashes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill the beast!     Kill the beast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The castle staff has now vanished, their barricade disman A series of bolts on the door slide open one by one, top bottom. The door unlocking itself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battering ram smashes the door one last time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill the beast!     Kill the beast! The door swings open easily and the mob tumbles inside, t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's EMPTY. Met by eerie silence, Gaston and the mob caut enter. The door barely hangs on its hinges. Villagers hold up torches. The flickering light reveals FURNITURE. Chairs. A coat rack. A feather duster. A candelabra. A tea pot and teacup. A harpsichord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you not the least bit concerned that this castle might be haunted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lose your nerve, LeFou. Gaston looks into the mirror. ANGLE ON LeFou -- he notice Mrs. Potts. Brings his torch close to study her. ANGLE ON THE MOB -- among them, Jean the potter stares at eerie castle foyer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place seems familiar... like I've been here before... Gaston approaches the west wing stairs.    LeFou brings h down to the tea pot and teacup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be the talking teacup.       And you must be his grandmother. Mrs. Potts' EYES open.   Furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grand-mother? ATTACK!                                     LeFou jumps back. ALL HELL BREAKS LOOSE as the furniture alive. Chairs kick the shins of several villagers. Plumet feathers villagers' faces furiously, causing them to have sneezing fits. As other villagers funnel in, the "Lend-a- lights outside the door bonk several of them on the head. They're alive after all. Chapeau spins Gaston around and is about to land a blow w GASTON GRABS LEFOU and puts him in the line of fire. LeFo becomes a human punching bag as Cadenza approaches and re up on his hind legs. His shadow falls across Gaston, who dives out of the way -- leaving LeFou exposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston!                                                   Cadenza comes crashing down on LeFou, squashing him flat. Gaston looks down at his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak, muffled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston... help...                                         Gaston looks from LeFou to the enchanted mirror, then to grand staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, old friend.   It's hero time.                      Gaston rushes up the staircase.   Lefou passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monsieur d'Arque paces in the square, when he notices the door to the asylum wagon is ajar. He runs to the wagon an flings open the doors, only to find it empty. D'Arque sla the doors shut -- and there's Maurice, smiling beside him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.    Oh, I believe this is yours.                    Maurice casually hands the wagon's padlock to Monsieur d'Arque -- just as Belle rides past on Philippe! As she charges out of the village gates, she tosses her ball gow the ground. Maurice waves to her proudly, then turns back to d'Arque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's very headstrong. Do you have                        children?                                                 Off d'Arque's confusion --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LeFou, bruised but alive, opens his eyes, sits up -- when Plumette furiously begins feathering his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one to protect you now, eh?!                           LeFou swats -- and Plumette flies away, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston finds himself at the landing of two staircases. Unsure which one leads to the beast, he holds up the mirr which illuminates the right way. Gaston bounds up them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip rapidly fires saucers at attackers, counting them of he dispatches them with glee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One!   Two!     Three!   Four!   Five!                    Above, Cogsworth looks down from the balcony, a tinhorn general surveying the battlefield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good show, Chip my boy!                                   Just then, a platoon of books arrives on the large table the library, battle-ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent! The infantry's arrived.                        Now go and teach them a lesson!                           The books rocket down into the fray, thwacking villager a villager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, those are called books, you third-                   rate musketeers!                                          This draws the attention of Tom, Dick and Stanley.   Cogs shudders --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm off!                                              -- and jumps down from the balustrade, as they bound up t stairs. They face off against Cogsworth, and he backs up quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, terribly sorry, pardon me, I'm                        just a clock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Garderobe leaps out, blocking the brutes' path, unfurls her fabric, wrapping them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's it... put it on... pretty                    little boys!                                             Tom and Dick look at each other and shriek, horrified at girly make-overs. Stanley, however, doesn't seem to mind new look. Garderobe cackles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 121              Go!   Be free! Be free! Be FREE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle on Philippe. She whips past the withered tree and d the path toward the castle grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the balcony, Mrs. Potts leaps onto a chandelier --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you take your tea?!    Piping                     hot?! Or boiling?!                                       -- and douses villagers below with boiling water.   She l down -- seeing Jean the potter -- and gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Potts?!                                           Suddenly, Mrs. Potts slips and drops down towards the flo Jean the potter looks on in confusion. Chip looks on in terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama!                                                    But just as she's about to shatter, she is caught by a pa of human hands. Mrs. Potts gazes up at -- LEFOU, who seem as surprised as she does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!   Thank you.                                         Suddenly, two villagers charge at LeFou from either side. LeFou ducks, the villagers wallop one another, Mrs. Potts spits hot water in their faces, and LeFou punches one out finish the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. POTTS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicely handled!                                         LEFOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I used to be on Gaston's side,                     but we're in a bad place right now.                     MRS. POTTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
