dialogues.text: You're too good for him anyway...                       LeFou nods, emotional. MRS. POTTS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we get back to it, then?!                         Below, Cadenza bucks and rages against villagers, besting them repeatedly as he plays elaborate trills. CADENZA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such sweet music! Ha ha, I'll play                      you like a concerto!                                    Clothilde watches this, and seethes. CLOTHILDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to Cadenza)                                 Silence that harpsichord!                               Clothilde's cry rallies a group of villagers, who raise t axes to turn maestro Cadenza into firewood. GARDEROBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maestro!                                                Cadenza looks up to see her. CADENZA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling!   At last!                                     GARDEROBE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shock becomes rage)                                I'm coming, my love! That's it!     The                 fat lady is singing!                                    Garderobe belts out a deafening high note and throws her massive girth off the balcony, sending Clothilde and the villagers below scattering. She lands with a graceful THU CADENZA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravissima! Before the villagers can retaliate, Cadenza's "teeth" sho out of his mouth like machine gun rounds. BAM BAM BAM! LumiГЁre runs around with gunpowder trail, creating a lin firecracker explosions that send villagers scattering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your toes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the chaos, we find Agathe, moving quietly through the villagers and up the stairs. What is she up to? As villagers pour out the doors, LumiГЁre and Cogsworth m at the base of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bon voyage! Safe trip home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And stay out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle rides Philippe towards the castle.     She kicks hi flanks and they double their speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaston steps slowly up onto the beast's turret. The beast senses his presence, turns. They lock eyes. Gaston cocks his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, beast. I am Gaston.    Belle sent me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle races up the stairs to the turret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With no hope left, the beast turns away from Gaston, whos finger tightens on the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you in love with her? Did you                        honestly think she'd want you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fires.   The beast drops over the edge. On the turret below, his claws make contact with the slan rooftop and break his fall. He hugs the rooftop, heaving. Gaston looks down over the edge of the turret. He pulls h crossbow and reaches back over his shoulder to draw an ar from his quiver -- but there's nothing there. Gaston spins to see Belle, and his arrows gripped in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?!                                             With that, Belle snaps Gaston's arrows over her knee, and tosses them away. Gaston grabs her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we return to the village, you will marry me, and the beast's head will hang on our wall!

dialogues.speaker: NEVER.
dialogues.text: She pulls away -- and uses this pivot to grab the barrel Gaston's pistol. They struggle. With Gaston on the back foot for a split second, Belle ya

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pistol hard. Gaston, not letting go, swings with it, and seeking balance on a loose stone, he drops off the side o turret! Gaston's reflexes are quick. He lets go of the pistol, gr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a gargoyle and swinging himself down through a window of turret. He lands on the spiral staircase. Gaston's pistol, in the meantime, clatters down, coming t on the landing of a stone footbridge below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wounded, the beast climbs around the lower turret. All ar him, turrets quaver and crack. The castle is imploding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming for you, beast!                                Gaston continues down until he reaches the bottom of the spiral staircase. He drops to a window box below, and jum sideways onto another. The beast makes a second leap, onto another parapet.   Ti slide away beneath him as he scrambles to hang on. Belle reaches the landing at the bottom of the spiral sta and leaps down onto another adjacent landing. She looks o trying to see the beast through the turrets. The beast swings around a third parapet and leaps onto an He's now as far as he can get from Gaston. Finally, Belle reaches a point where she can see the beas the faraway turret. She screams out as his grip slips.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: The beast's head turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle? And he spots her. THE BEAST (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (roars)                                               BELLE! You came back!                                     BELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to stop them!                                     THE BEAST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay there! I'm coming!                                   Gaston drops onto the walkway lined with gargoyles, landi directly between the beast and Belle. He sneers -- the up hand is still his. His eyes search for a weapon... he gra a stone spire, and breaks it off. With superhuman agility, the beast makes a giant leap fro far parapet back toward the central turrets. Back toward Belle descends the stairs, finally reaching the beast's l The beast lands on the gargoyle walk and Gaston jumps out bringing his club cracking down on the beast's back. The beast roars in pain. But he pushes past Gaston. With Gaston landing blow after blow on the beast's back, beast staggers down a set of stairs onto the landing of a footbridge (where Gaston's pistol came to rest earlier).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!     Gaston, no!                                     Belle watches the beast lumbering across the footbridge - crumbles under each mighty footfall. The beast reaches the cupola on the far side, directly parallel to the lair. One giant leap stands between him a Belle... Gaston lifts the club to deliver the death blow -- when t beast snatches it. He yanks the club away and hurls it against a far wall. With a snarl, the beast's paw is around Gaston's throat. lifts Gaston and swings him out over the edge of the land GASTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snivelling) No. Don't let me go. Please. Don't hurt me, beast. I'll do anything. TIGHT ON THE BEAST -- his features twisted with rage and but he controls himself -- and his anger fades.

dialogues.speaker: I AM NOT A BEAST.
dialogues.text: He sets Gaston down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go.   Get out. Gaston scrambles to his feet, and the beast lunges, chasi him away down the outer staircase of the cupola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle gazes proudly into the beast's eyes, across the fin chasm that separates them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beast has just enough distance for a head start to le across to the lair balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!   It's too far! But the beast has already gotten down on all fours. His h claws dig into the stone. And then he's off, gaining spee he runs on all legs. Belle gasps -- and the beast leaps. He's airborne, flying over the chasm -- and he just makes the balcony -- landing on all fours! He rises, and smiles BOOM! The beast roars in agony. Past him, across the chas Belle spots Gaston on the crumbling walkway, pistol back hand. He grins as he reloads for the kill shot -- and as watches, helpless, he takes aim again -- and fires. The beast drops -- just as the walkway beneath Gaston collapses. In an instant, there's nothing beneath his fee and he disappears, screaming, in a cascade of stones. Belle cradles the beast's head. Anguished. He lies there, breathing heavily. Softly, the beast rests his paw on Bel hand. Fading, his eyes look at her with perfect love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I came back.   I'll never leave you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid it's my turn to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're together now.   It's going to be                   fine. You'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least I got to see you one last time. The paw drops as the beast dies in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... please, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As villagers stagger away in defeat, LumiГЁre turns to Pl takes her in his arms, about to give her a V-Day kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did it, Plumette.   Victory is ours. Plumette is silent in LumiГЁre's embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plumette...? Oh! My dear Plumette...                      Cogsworth helps LumiГЁre lower Plumette to the ground. Op them, Garderobe stands beside Cadenza, reunited at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, maestro! You were so brave!                           Goodbye, my love...                                       Her arms retract -- as the footlights inside her dim and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling!   No, don't leave me!                            Cadenza sobs. We move along the few keys he has left unti freeze into silence. We TILT UP to the music stand. No hi a face. Froufrou emerges from the foyer, pawing at his ma and mistress, then goes still. Nothing more than a piano now. Mrs. Potts frantically approaches Cogsworth and LumiГЁre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP! CHIP! Have you seen Chip!? He ran off! Oh, where is my little boy -- LumiГЁre and Cogsworth watch in horror as Mrs. Potts' fac disappears into the painted ornamentation of the tea pot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama!                                                     LumiГЁre turns to Cogsworth, panicked that Chip might see what's happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as he leaps up, his features fade away and gravity t over. The saucer plummets, shattering. But Chapeau catche Chip in mid-air -- and lovingly places him, inanimate, on the trolley cart beside Mrs. Potts. Chapeau straightens himself nobly, and becomes a coat rac All around Cogsworth and LumiГЁre, the staff goes still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LumiГЁre... I... TICK... can't... CHIME... speak...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, Cogsworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... can't... TICK... LumiГЁre, my friend... TOCK... it was an honor to serve with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only sound Cogsworth makes is `tick tock, tick tock.' LumiГЁre is alone. Surrounded by objects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The honor was mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LumiГЁre does a final twirl and stiffens.      He is a ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON THE BELL JAR. The final rose petal drops -- just a HOODED FIGURE appears. We move up to reveal: AGATHE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the beast)                                      Please, don't leave me.    Come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON BELLE -- her lips touch the beast's forehead in kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing these words, Agathe smiles benevolently and place her hand on the bell jar -- which explodes and releases a wave of rose petals, whirling into the air. A golden light begins to emanate from Agathe. It encircle the beast and he too begins to rise. Belle gets to her fe watching as the beast is lifted and enveloped by the swir aurora, and then buffeted gently back down to reveal --

dialogues.speaker: THE PRINCE
dialogues.text: He lands on his feet and looks down at his hands, his arm his chest. He turns -- and sees Belle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle... Slowly he steps toward her, and she to him. In silent disbelief, Belle runs her fingers through his h She looks into the Prince's blue eyes. It is him. Tears o grief turn to tears of joy as they lean in for their firs kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magic explodes outwards. And with it, the dawn breaks. Th castle transforms like someone is giving it a wash of gol magic spreads across the balcony as the sun rises on the terrace, traveling down the castle facade -- creepy stone gargoyles turn into noble statuary --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the light passes over, an upside-down FROUFROU transfo back into a tiny BICHON FRISE basking in the sun. He leap and chases his tail (still a tassle), then trots over to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and relieves himself on his leg -- which changes into a h foot. Chapeau transforms back into a VALET and shoos the dog with his walking stick. As the dog weaves through his the valet loses his balance and bumps into the trolley holding Mrs. Potts and Chip. It starts to roll toward stairs. The valet backs into Garderobe, who waddles in and out of sunlight, changing from wardrobe to human to wardrobe aga Cadenza's face comes alive as he sees the wardrobe fallin onto him. As it crashes, the wardrobe's doors fly open, sending out a flurry of garments. We follow them back to ground, where the human DIVA now lies on top of the human MAESTRO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Madame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Maestro. The maestro smiles his now-toothless grin.    She tearful embraces him -- as their dog joins in. The trolley rolls past, taking us to Cogsworth, whose bac bathed in sunlight. We move around to reveal the pudgy MAJORDOMO, human except for his moustache, which still resembles the hands of a clock. He peers through his monocle, sees -- The French FOOTMAN (formerly LumiГЁre) come into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LumiГЁre!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cogsworth, we beat the clock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mon ami.                                                 They greet each other as a feather floats by, brushing th footman's nose. They look over to see -- A pile of feathers... from which the footman pulls the sexiest French MAID in history, her feathers blossoming i a dress around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plumette... mon amour...                                 And then, the greatest kiss ever. Their passion ignites a tiny flame on the footman's head, which the maid pats out They turn as they hear -- The trolley SQUEAKING as it nears the steps, about to cra down. Mrs. Potts and Chip rattle on a tray, which suddenl jerks to a stop on the precipice. The valet has hooked th cart with his walking stick, but... Mrs. Potts and Chip slide down the incline... shoot off t tray... and start to TRANSFORM IN MID-AIR! They sled to t bottom of the steps and skid to a halt, fully human again CHIP hugs his MOTHER... he finally got her to skate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Chip! What did I tell you? Look                      at you -- you're a little boy again!                     Oh you smell so good!                                    From the castle grounds, astonished villagers approach, blinking, as the veil is lifted from their memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Potts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beatrice!     Chip!   I remember!   I do!                They embrace -- a family reunited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wonderful emotion-filled reunion. STABLE BOYS, KITCHEN MAIDS, ARTISANS, GROUNDSKEEPERS, GUARDS, and SEAMSTRESSES reunited in human form. Among the happy villagers, we find Cogsworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry? He spins to see Clothilde - his wife.       Gulp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   DEAR! She hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been so lonely. He shuts his eyes tight and whispers to himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn back into a clock... turn back into a clock... LumiГЁre and Plumette embrace, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LumiГЁre, look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my Prince! BELLE AND THE PRINCE emerge.        He rushes to Lumiere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, old friend. Lumiere is taken aback by the warm embrace of his master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so good to see you! Belle and the Prince are surrounded by the staff.       P curtsies to Belle --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved our lives, mademoiselle. -- As Chip runs up and hugs her tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belle, it's me!     It's Chip! "BEAUTY AND THE BEAST" starts to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire village celebrates as Cadenza -- smiling with dentures -- plays the harpsichord with his beautiful wife Garderobe singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tale as old as time Tune as old as song Bittersweet and strange Finding you can change Learning you were wrong We glide past various familiar faces: LeFou; LumiГЁre wal with Plumette; Cogsworth with Clothilde; Chip and his fat Jean the Potter... and finally Mrs. Potts. She beams as s watches Belle dance with the Prince, then crosses to acknowledge Maurice, who sits at an easel, sketching the celebration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter turns to spring Famine turns to feast Nature points the way Nothing left to say Beauty and the Beast Belle runs her hand down the Prince's smooth cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you feel about growing a                       beard?                                                   He growls playfully. As they laugh, we PULL OUT to reveal the ballroom in all its restored splendor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certain as the sun Rising in the East Tale as old as time Song as old as rhyme Beauty and the Beast
